195501.name: Coloured Yatzy
195501.description:
Coloured Yatzy is a variant on the classic yatzy game. Instead of dice the players throw pyramid shaped prisms with 4 different coloured corners.

From the box:

A Twist on the classic game. A Fast playing game of fun and skill. Throw the colourful Yatzy Prisms up to 3 times to score on your turn. Can you match a pair, a full-house, a small or high straight or even 4 of a kind? Matching 8 of a kind scores the highest value Yatzy.

195502.name: Deception: Murder in Hong Kong – Dice Tower 2016 Kickstarter Promo Pack
195502.description: 4 promo cards (2 x means, 2 x evidence) which were available through as a reward for the 2016 Season 12 Dice Tower Kickstarter

195503.description:
In City of Iron, 2-4 players compete to build up a small nation in a world of machines, magic, and money. Become the leader of one of four rival nations: the industrious humans, the toad engineers, the scholarly Cresarians, or the clever hogmen. Produce goods like machine parts and bottled demons to gain wealth, or research steam-age technology and recruit mercenaries to control the continent. If you want to establish new cities, you’ll build schooners or airships to reach faraway lands and flying islands. Your cities have limited capacity, so you’ll have to decide what to keep and what to demolish when building advanced structures. The future of a nation is in your hands. Build unbreakable foundations for an empire or disappear into the dusty pages of history.

Differences from the first edition:


The expert cards have some new iconography and have been rebalanced
The expansion town card deck is gone
The auction for player order has been simplified
The pay track for going later in the turn is gone
A bonus coin replaced the pirates
The timing of scoring rounds has been changed
Players now have different end-game scoring goals depending on their contract cards and regions, rather than everyone competing for the same set of end-game bonuses
195503.name: City of Iron: Second Edition
boardgamepodcastepisode: City of Iron 2nd ed Review with the Game Boy Geek
Ep 6 - Favor of the Pharaoh & City of Iron 2nd Ed.
Episode 48 - City of Iron 2nd Ed.
The Long View - Quick Looks #16
The WDYPTW Conversation Thing with Ryan Laukat ep 85.06

195504.name: Sheriff of Nottingham: 2016 Dice Tower Kickstarter Promo Pack
195504.description:
2 promo cards (King's Decree and Gemstone) which were available as a reward for the 2016 Dice Tower Season 12 Kickstarter.

King's Decree: If King's Decree is in a bag with only one other legal good and it is checked, the sheriff must pay 15 gold as a penalty.

Gemstone: A rare gem can only be taken in a bag with a total of two items, you must reveal the gem after a successfully smuggling it through to prove it came through in a bag of 2 goods.

195505.name: Host (2007)
195505.description:
User summary:

The game is played with exactly two players who compete head-to-head for the control of a single character. One player represents the Possessor and one player represents the Host. The game is played as a series of narrative developments which are tracked on a hexagonal grid using tokens (the game suggests using Reversi style tokens. When one player finally gains control of the single central hex that player has won complete control of the single character.

195506.name: Quadropolis: The Cruise Ship
195506.description:
A promo tile available as a reward in the 2016 Dice Tower Season 12 Kickstarter.

The tile features a cruise ship with the anchor symbol (harbour), which is powered by 2 meeples and grants 4 VP.

Quadropolis: The Cruise Ship (5310Z) replaces harbor tile 5310

195508.description: Into the Echoside features game play and a theme that is unique to any other deck building game. It includes everything you need to play including a game board, 12-sided die, rulebook and over 220 cards that pay homage to everything Juggalos love. There are 6 different types of cards in the game (Dark Carnival, Psychopathic, Underground, Item, Fiend and Epic) each one representing a person, character, song or thing from the Juggalo world. There are such cards as Juggalos, Moon Glorious, Vera Lee, Mr. White Suit, The Riddle Box, Rude Boy, DJ Clay, Psychopathic Rydas, Whitney Peyton, Kottonmouth Kings, Boondox, Jamie Madrox, Black Eyed Children, Murder Cloak, Chuck the Chainsaw, Cartoon Nightmares, Mr. Rotten Treats and Boogie Man just to name a very very few! Players will have the opportunity to wield the powers bestowed upon them by some of their favorite artists and characters!
195508.name: Into The Echoside

195509.name: Dead Ends
195509.description:
Dead Ends is a solitaire card game where the player shuffles the cards, then places the Entrance card on the top of the deck, and the Exit card on the bottom.

The cards consist of Path Cards - hallways, intersections, and dead ends - Item Cards - which can be used at certain spots in the game - and Choice Cards - where the player needs to make a decision regarding their path.

The goal is to reach the end of the deck without getting lost. The player loses the game by getting "lost", meaning that they have no possible exits from the most recent intersection on their map.

195510.name: Faust and Friends
195510.description:
From the introduction:

Just because you have a steady supply of demonic favors at your call, doesn’t mean that life is all easy. The one thing Mephisto can’t do is control people’s minds. Which means if you want that boy you’ve had a crush on to fall for you, you’ll have do it the old fashioned way.

Because in Faust and Friends, the relationships (friends, enemies, lovers, and so on) you have are the most important part. Vast wealth, undying pleasures, and long forgotten wisdom are fun and all, but in the end, its what you make of the people around you that matters.

195511.name: Murasaki Mist: Akara's Journey
195511.description:
It´s been a thousand years since Mythria is ruled by the Dark Lords, demons from another realm who were summoned by the blind ambition of one man.

As the world is coming to an end, Akara, a peaceful young woman who mastered the Dark Arts swears to protect Mythria and end the Stigma that was cast upon the 9 Kingdoms.

Source: The Game Website.

195512.name: Cast Off: A Game of Inappropriate Casting
195512.description: Cast Off is a party game where you’ll put actors, characters, and other voices in an audition for a well known film. You’ll score points as your team tries to guess information about the film, and who was trying out for what part, with as few as 4 people or as many friends as you’d like to laugh with.

195513.name: Demesne
195513.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

Build and survive in taiga.

195514.name: The Owls
195514.description:
(publisher blurb)

This is a short (half an hour to an hour) two player (PC + GM) narrative RPG. There is no resolution system - the GM decides how things play out. Note: The preview is the entire game. Feel free to read it on here, and download it if you need an offline copy.

The character wakes up in a clearing with no idea of how they got there, and must try to find a way back to their own world.

195515.description:
From the publisher:

The Chosin Few is a solitaire wargame depicting the events of the Battle of the Chosin Reservoir during the Korean War, November - December, 1950. The historic outcome was a pyrrhic victory for the Chinese.

I made this game because I am in awe of what happened at this battle. Of what the marines accomplished. In my opinion it was a modern day Thermopylae. The difference between the two battles being that in Thermopylae the Spartans were at least able to take advantage of the Terrain to minimize the Persian’s numerical advantage. But in this battle the US forces were completely surrounded. They had no way of evening the odds at all. But somehow, caused such devastation to the Chinese forces that they had to permanently disband 2 of their divisions and the remaining divisions were still under-strength for 7 months.

You control the United Nations X-Corps, which primarily consisted of US Marine and Army forces. Particularly the 1st Marine Division and 7th Infantry Division.

The game’s AI system will control the Chinese forces as they come pouring over the border into Korea and surround you.





Components

Board
Rules
25 cards (2.5"x3.5"; 63.5mmx88mm)
11 counters
2 standees
20 cubes
1 six-sided die
195515.name: The Chosin Few

195516.name: Games of the Gods
195516.description:
User summary:

Characters in this game are gods. As they do not participate in conflict directly, they are not defined with Attributes, etc. Instead, the player can craft a basic personality. The characters influence human pawns to perform tasks (or to attempt to thwart other character's human pawns' tasks). In the game, the characters are in direct competition with each other. Action primarily is narrative. A dice pool mechanism is used to resolve conflict during the phases of the game.

195517.description:
Welcome to Chicago. Don’t smell the gunpowder in the air or the scent of perfume coming from the whorehouses or the aftershave of the mobsters hanging around the corner.

Stay alert, grab your bucks before your enemies beat you to it, build your gang fast and better than all the rest. Because the next thing you smell could be the flowers on your grave.

The game is based by an innovative system of play called "confronts": each mobster, according to his skills to do an action, must confront the power of the Gang (coming from influence tokens) with all other powers in the same district.

Each of the players plays a Boss of a Gang on Chicago or the Police Chief at the beginning of the 1920. To rule the city, as Boss, you must command your mobsters as pawn to earn money coming from robbery, run clubs and assassinate enemies. If you represent the Law, instead, you must fight the crime with your policemen, closing the clubs, capturing mobsters and also try to send one of the Bosses to jail.
195517.name: Bucks, Bullets & Flowers
boardgamepodcastepisode: Play 2016: le novità ludiche – Il Dado Incantato #5

195518.description:
Crazy Karts is a team-based, fast-paced racing game for 3-8 players, who compete in teams of two in which each player controls specific actions of their kart, but they cannot communicate with their teammate!

In more detail, one player controls the brakes and turns, while the other player speeds up and fires the cannon. Teams must outmaneuver their opponents, dodge obstacles, grab power-ups, and avoid smashing into the walls, all planning their actions in secret without talking! Need to turn left? Better hope your partner didn't accelerate! Race to the finish line in this wacky game of mayhem and shenanigans. Do you have what it takes to be a champion kart racer?

As with many other titles from Portal Games, Crazy Karts includes four unique factions for the teams, each with their unique power. If you are play with an odd number of players, a Lone Wolf faction allows a single player to compete with a unique set of skills and disadvantages.
195518.name: Crazy Karts
boardgamepodcastepisode: Crazy Karts Review with the Game Boy Geek
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 015 – Top 10 Mechanisms
Episode 24 - Labeling Games: Useful or Harmful?
Episode 76- The Networks and Origins 2016
Podcast 35 – Crazy Karts
RDTN Episode 88: I Can’t Drive 55 – Ignacy is in the house, Sularia Card Game, GAMA Thoughts
RDTN Episode 94: One of the Living – Reviews of 51st State and Crazy Karts

195519.name: Kingdom: An Enchanting Game
195519.description: Kingdom is a game where players battle against each other trying to be the first to match “The Ideal Kingdom” which needs to be made of the right collection of cards. However, the right cards needed in this game may not be the right cards in another game. True, you may pull the same set of cards, but it is highly unlikely there are 531,441 different combinations. You could push ahead getting the right cards in the positions you need them to be in, or do you work to thwart other players efforts. Adding the change a winning combination of the ideal kingdom allows for changes in strategy from one game to the next. Each player starts with three cards and needs to work to create the “Ideal Kingdom” which is a combination of six cards. Each color of card has specific attacks, defense, and special action. Certain colors cards can only sit next to other certain color cards, and coming in contact with opposing cards leads to inactivity or removal. That has something to do with court politics. Cards are drawn and played in turn order, with actions being directed by the cards you have laid out in front of you. Some of those actions allow you to draw extra cards, look at another player’s cards, steal cards, or battle. But, your strategy has to be planned so you can create the ideal kingdom to win. There are 9 major game changer cards in the deck, like creating Immunity from the Black Plague, or Jesters that will play tricks and change the cards. This actually helps the player with the least amount of cards to actually come back and try to win.

195520.name: Hoplomachus: Army of One
195520.description: This Add-on features 13 chips! 2 Titans and a giant 3 chip crab for solo fights in RoR, and 2 full battle reenactments for TLC (Hannibal Barca and his elephant army and Attila the Hun)!

195521.name: Hoplomachus: Origins – Staging Mat
195521.description: Our Hoplo: Origins Staging Mat is something we offered along with our Origins Kickstarter. While not exclusive, it was ordered in limited quantity and will not always be kept in stock. The mat plays no strategic role in the game and is simply a nice way of protecting your chip faces by always having them on a neoprene mat. This staging mat has room for each of your drafted units as well as a place to stack any that have fallen. It fits right next to any of the 3 Origins arenas and is a great addition to the game.

195522.name: Hoplomachus: Dice Pack
195522.description: Pack includes 6 extra Hoplo dice (1 Black, 1 Green, 2 Blue, 2 Yellow).

195523.name: Stories: The Path of Destinies
videogamehonor: 2016 CVA Best Canadian-Made Game of the Year Nominee
2016 CVA Best Indie Game of the Year Winner
2016 CVA Best PC Game of the Year Winner
2016 CVA Game of the Year Nominee
195523.description:
User Summary

In the mystical realm of Boreas, only a clever but unlucky fox has the power to bring an end to a war created by the Emperor gone mad.

195524.name: Paper Mario: Color Splash
videogamehonor: 2016 Global Game Awards Best Childrens Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Golden Geek Best Wii U Game Winner
195524.description:
Paper Mario returns to a Nintendo console! Prism Island is being drained of its colour in this action-adventure. Paper Mario’s paint hammer splashes paint on anything it hits, so he uses it to bring the colour back to the island.

Source: The Publisher Website.

195525.name: DUAL GEAR
195525.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




DUAL GEAR is a turn base and action game inspired from Japanese mecha design.

Source: The Game Website.

195526.name: Kirby: Planet Robobot
videogamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best 3DS Game Runner Up
2016 Golden Joystick Nintendo Console Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Villain of the Year Nominee
2017 D.I.C.E. Best Handheld Game of the Year Nominee
195526.description:
Harness the power of a mysterious mech to stop ruthless invaders from mechanizing Kirby's home world. Smash through tough obstacles, lift heavy objects with ease, and scan enemies to shape-shift into new Modes with powerful abilities in this supercharged action-platformer!

That's right—Kirby's Robobot Armor can shape-shift into different modes by scanning enemies to copy their moves—like the new Jet Mode. Not to mention, Kirby™ can copy abilities the old-fashioned way too—by inhaling them! After saving the world, team up with three friends to defeat foes in Team Kirby Clash, an RPG-styled 4-player* brawl where you choose from varied roles and level them up.

Use the mysterious Robobot Armor to scan enemies and shape-shift into powerful Modes
Kirby's Copy Ability returns, allowing him to inhale, spit out foes, and copy abilities
Use the Download Play feature in Team Kirby Clash, an RPG-styled mode for up to 4 players* (or sharpen your skills by playing solo)

Additional systems and games are required for multiplayer mode; sold separately.




Source: The Publisher Website.

195527.name: Metroid Prime: Federation Force
videogamehonor: 2016 Gamescom Best Mobile/Handheld Game of the Year Nominee
195527.description:
The galaxy is not at peace. Samus™ may have won the battle, but the war on the Space Pirates is far from over. Enlist with the Federation Force to join a four-player* local or online** squad in this co-op sci-fi shooter. Fight alongside teammates in your specialized Mech to eliminate the Space Pirate menace and any threat that stands in your way.

Make it a solitary mission or join 3 friends* for increased firepower and deeper strategies. In each mission, you'll choose your role on the team by selecting from different subweapons and MODs to customize your Mech and maximize your chance of survival. Whether you focus on healing allies or increasing your arsenal, your greatest asset is teamwork. Work together, tackle missions, take down bosses, and defeat hostile creatures as one powerful unit. The dangerous Metroid™ universe is now at your mercy. Honor your vow to protect it and fight back...before there's nothing left to fight for. The next chapter in the Metroid Prime™ saga is here.

Up to 4 players* take on a variety of co-op missions in this first-person, sci-fi shooter set in the Metroid™ universe
Work solo or together as a team to clear out enemy-infested bases and complete objective-based missions against the Space Pirate menace
Customize your Mech with MODs and subweapons to define your role on the team
Discover the futuristic bliss that is Metroid Prime™: Blast Ball, a 3-on-3 sci-fi sport in the Metroid universe where players literally shoot the ball into their opponents' goal to score
Aim using the Nintendo 3DS™ system's gyroscope or use the C-Stick on the New Nintendo 3DS system for dual-analog control

Source: The Publisher Website.

195528.description:
La Granja: No Siesta is a standalone dice game following up the boardgame La Granja.

The players need to collect resources to cross them off on their scoring sheet in order to get the most victory points. They can hire helpers to use their special effects. They build a barn to store goods and sometimes they need to have a little time off and have a Siesta!

The dice game singles out the dice mechanism from the boardgame and transfers it into a much lighter game. Every round the players roll the dice and draft them until everybody has at least three dice to score.

Once a player completes the siesta track the game comes to an end. Whoever collected resources in the most effective way will win the game!
195528.name: La Granja: No Siesta
boardgamepodcastepisode: 19. Devon Dice Dreaming to Essen trip 2016, Top 10 wants to Buys
Episode 39 - Our Most Anticipated Games in 2017
Episode 69 - Brew Crafters
The Game Pit Podcast: Episode 73 - Spiel ‘16 Treasure Hunt Part 3
The Good The Board and Jon and Nate plus…10: Episode 97″Nate’s top 10 of 2016″

195529.name: Dead in Bermuda
195529.description:
DEAD IN BERMUDA is a survival management game with RPG and adventure elements, in which you lead a team of 8 survivors from a plane crash on a strange island. Assign your survivors to tasks, gain experience and level up your survival skills, research and craft new items for the camp, explore the island for resources and solve the mysteries behind an ancient atlantean prophecy.

Source: The Developer Website.

195530.name: Harvest Moon: Hero of Leaf Valley
195530.description:
The player travels to Sugar Village to pick up his grandfather's things after hearing that he has died. He learns that the village will be turned into an amusement park, and encounters three "Harvest sprites" and the Harvest Goddess, who ask him to stay on the farm and help them. The player then decides to take over his grandfather's farm and work hard to turn the village around. By choosing different paths, you can find up to 16 ways to save the village.

Source: Wikipedia, "Harvest Moon: Hero of Leaf Valley", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

195531.description: These 11.5 gram chips are the same weight as the unit chips within our Hoplo Series. For a nice upgrade to the overall quality and enjoyment of your Hoplo game, pick up a set of Premium Health chips! Qty: 50 chips (25 Red and 25 Blue) or 125 chips (100 Red and 25 Blue) in a set.
195531.name: Hoplomachus: Premium Health Chips

195532.name: Courtroom Clash
195532.description:
User summary:

The characters in the game do not have Attributes or Skills with numeric values; characters are defined by narrative tags. The game master creates the crime and circumstances and play proceeds as the two attorneys battle it out. A stripped pack of French playing cards is used to introduce random events to the narrative. Resolution occurs when the Judge renders judgement.

boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Print & Play Board Game Nominee
195533.description:
SUMMARY

You and your band of scallywag pirates are in deep, deep trouble. Something you’ve never seen before has been following your ship, seeking revenge, growing stronger with rage. Perhaps you took one treasure too many, and now fate is closing in. So hurry while the wind is brave in your sails! Sail from island to island, scouting, fighting, looting for treasure, and spending your loot to live out tale worthy adventures.

GOAL
Be the last surviving pirate with the best adventure to tell.

GAMEPLAY
Players take action using the map draw deck to expand the board, move, search for resources, place workers, complete adventure cards, and attack each other. As each round ends the AI player increases strength and moves in to attack the nearest player. This forces players to end their turn as far away as possible by either expanding the map or moving. Resources in hand and large boards will result in shorter rounds making it harder as the game progresses. Players not eliminated by the AI or other players win. If both survive the adventures determine the victory.
195533.name: Haze Islands
boardgamepodcastepisode: 1P 116 - The Grizzled
Episode 36 - Kingmaking: Real or Imagined Problem?

195534.name: Grassroots: The RPG of Public Opinion
rpg: Grassroots: The RPG of Public Opinion
195534.description:
From the game:

[P]unching out a Senator just gets you throw in in jail. Revealing his secret affair with an underage prostitute? That's a revenge that will last forever.

User summary:

Characters in the game are defined by Abilities (Attributes), Resources, Values, and Threads (Traits). Abilities range from 2 to 10 and, sometimes, higher. Each Ability is aligned with a suit in a stripped deck of French playing cards: Passion (Hearts), Logic (Spades), Truthiness (Clubs), and Reputation (Diamonds). The Ability rank corresponds to a card rank, used during conflict resolution. Character Resources are much like Skills but are more inclusive. Values are narrative traits that define the character's inviolate principles. Finally, Threads represent the efforts the character is engaged in.

While the game can be played with a single deck of cards, play is greatly facilitated by the use of multiple decks with different backs.

195535.description:
The solo, card laying game, for lovers of architecture aged 10 and over, by Charles Ward.

SUMMARY
Complete the plan for a luxurious mansion, maximise the layout, and comply with 3 simple design principles.

GAMEPLAY
Having set aside the 2 external doors cards, the player will draw 1 card at a time and place it on, under, or next to other cards, in either orientation, covering all or part of the existing cards to create a floor plan. The floor plan must connect 2 external doors via a corridor (described as a very long room) with doors leading off to rooms. Each room scores you one point. But each penalty subtracts one point. The 3 design principles that cause a penalty are: doors that open onto walls, missing walls (making a room or corridor open to the outside world), and rooms that are inaccessible.
195535.name: The Architect

195536.name: FOOD FIGHT: A Game of Scones
195536.description:
A competitive skirmish nano card game by Charles Ward.

SUMMARY
Players play on a card size board with 9 spaces. The spaces are not connected equally and some spaces have an advantage when doing a ranged attack. Players move tokens on the board trying to eliminate the opponent's pieces and be as close as possible to their opponent's picnic spot at the end of the game. Players take actions by playing their hand of 8 cards, or both sides of the four cards. The game ends at the end of round 8, or after all cards have been played.

GAMEPLAY
Players choose 1 card from their hand (either the top or bottom half of that card) and simultaneously reveal them. The player with the highest initiative number (in the coin) goes first, and each player either takes 1 of the 2 actions on their card's chosen half or passes. Cards that have been played once are flipped from the silver coin side to the gold coin side and return to the players hand; cards played twice are discarded.

On their turn a player may move 1 or more of their tokens, attack in the same location or a target location, block, hide, taunt, or add 1 reinforcement. Although the actions are resolved in order (highest number card), a block or hide can cancel a certain type of attack as a reaction or preemptively.

The game ends after 8 rounds, when all cards have been discarded. Equidistant tokens are removed after which the player nearest to the opponent's star wins.

rpg: I Forget What Eight Was For...
195537.name: I Forget What Eight Was For...
195537.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game have four Stats (Attributes), including Fight, Brains, Perception, and Will. The player assigns a d4, d6, d8, and d12 to the Stats at creation time. Characters also have three general Skills (Brawling, Lore, Sneaking) and may select three other Skills from a list. Skills are based on a Stat. A few other narrative traits round out character creation.

The game has a heavy focus on combat and fighting, and the mechanic uses modified dice rolls and "bennies", or "benefit tokens" that may be earned and played. Characters may also lose sanity instead of just health.

195538.name: Masquerade (2007)
195538.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game assume one of two distinct roles - some are charlatans, some are physicians. They both travel through the campaign world trying to cure a plague. Neither type has the tools to complete the task, nor can they cure the plague working in tandem. The game uses a game master (here, the Rose Queen) and suggests that dice, etc., can be used if the group finds such use comfortable or useful. However, the rules as presented are freeform and based entirely around narrative development.

195539.description:
Designer Eric Lang, known for his "dudes on a map" games, describes The Godfather: Corleone's Empire — a standalone big box board game with high-quality miniatures — as "thugs on a map".

In short, the game is a streamlined, confrontational worker placement game filled with murder and intrigue. In long, you play as competing mafia families who are vying for economic control of the organized crime networks of New York City, deploying your thugs, your don, your wife, and your heir on the board to shake down businesses and engage in area-control turf wars.

Money, rackets, contracts, and special advantages (such as the union boss) are represented by cards in your hand, and your hand size is limited, with you choosing which extra cards to pay tribute to the don at the end of each of the five rounds. At the end of the game, though, cash is all that matters, and whoever has the most money wins.

The game also features drive-by shootings in which enemy tokens are removed from the board and placed face-down in the river. The don of that family member must play cards to fish their guys out of the river and return them to duty on the New York battlefield.
195539.name: The Godfather: Corleone's Empire
boardgamepodcastepisode: #21: The Grizzled on tap, CMoN Expo, The Beer Traveler: Atlanta
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 015 – Top 10 Mechanisms
Episode 20: The one all about CMON Expo
RDTN Episode 92: Midnight Train to Georgia – CMON Expo, Eric Lang, Rodney Smith and Action Phase Games

195542.name: Drive-In Pulp
195542.description:
B-Movie RolePlaying

From the back of the book:

New Archetypes, New Rules, New Advantages and More takes the action from the streets and jungles of the world to the gritty grindhouse and drive-in theaters where nearly anything goes!

195543.description:
Imperial Settlers: 3 Is a Magic Number, the second Empire Pack for Imperial Settlers, introduces a new rule: SET. This new ability allows players to score and trigger new effects each time they build three cards in a particular color. With this rule, the drafting phase and the choice of the "right" card to draft becomes even more interesting.

This expansion includes new cards for the common deck as well as new cards for each of the five factions and two cards for use in the solitaire game.
195543.name: Imperial Settlers: 3 Is a Magic Number
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 017 – Our Podcast Subscriptions
Ep 043 – Essen Part II Expansion Preview
RDTN Episode 94: One of the Living – Reviews of 51st State and Crazy Karts

boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee
195544.description:
Tides of Madness is a sequel to Tides of Time and features gameplay similar to that design. Tides of Time is a drafting game for two players. Each game consists of three rounds in which players draft cards from their hands to build their kingdom. Each card is one of five suits and also has a scoring objective.

After all cards have been drafted for the round, players total their points based on the suits of cards they collected and the scoring objectives on each card, then they record their score. Each round, the players each select one card to leave in their kingdom as a "relic of the past" to help them in later rounds. After three rounds, the player with the the most prosperous kingdom wins.

Tides of Madness adds a new twist to the above game: madness. Some cards, while powerful, harm your psyche, so you must keep an eye on your madness level or else risk losing the game early as your mind is lost to the power of the ancients. More specifically, eight of the eighteen cards in the game feature a madness icon, and while scoring, you receive a madness token for each such icon in your collection of cards. Whoever has the most madness in a round either scores 4 points or discards 1 madness token — and the latter option is valuable because if you ever have nine or more madness, you lose the game immediately.
195544.name: Tides of Madness
boardgamepodcastepisode: 38 – The Family Gamers Podcast – Twice Married
DJ107: Las Mareas del Tiempo (2015) Kristian Čurla
Ep 043 – Essen Part II Expansion Preview
Episode 61 - Mansions of Madness 2nd Ed. Halloween Spooktacular
RDTN Episode 97: Reviews of Tyrants of the Underdark, Simurgh, Mystic Vale, My Village, Tides of Madness and Others
Strange Assembly 193 - GenCon 2016 in Review
WIPNcast 128

195545.description:
How many of you remember the old videogames of the '80s – '90s where you had to be extremely skilled in cabinet to strip completely super-pixelled girls?

Oppai Go has been created from this idea, a “strategic” game in which each player has a sexy female alter ego taken on a desert island as a sort of “Battle Royale” or “The Hunger Games”, with the exception of only wearing underwear. Unfortunately the fate is not by your side (or maybe yes?), because you will be “forced” to use every means at your disposal to fully undress your opponents and try to earn your way back home.

The goal of the game is to have the most victory points at the end. Players get VP by stripping their opponents of their clothes (or accessories).

The accessory token moves from one space to another to denote the state of dress of each character. The possible states are as follows:
1. Naked: The accessory token is off the character sheet and the character is flipped to the naked side
2. Pants: The character is only wearing pants (token on pants space)
3. Bra: The character is wearing bra and pants (token on bra space)
4. Armor: The character is wearing bra and pants, and also armor (token on armor space)
5. Weapon: The character has a weapon, armor, bra and panties (token on weapon space)

The game is divided into rounds, each round is split into phases. Note that some phases are played in clockwise order and some others in anticlockwise order.

Each player faces a round always with 3 cards in hand, drawing them from the central common deck. Cards could have some effects like removing accessories to an opponent (or to everyone), gain 1 accessory, defend from opposing actions, etc.

The cards can be played by the hand, can be held (covered) on the table (to be played during the next rounds) or can be discarded. All played cards form a sort of pile in order to activate their effects from the last played card to the first one.

The held cards go always on the top of the pile, so their effects start first. There's only one problem: the card on the top of the discard pile determines the Seed, that is the color of cards that cannot be played among the held ones.

This is a game full of funny surprises, bluff, ruthless combos and embarrassing situations.
195545.name: Oppai Go

195547.name: LOAD: League of Ancient Defenders
195547.description:
LOAD is a miniature game of epic clashing action! In LOAD, players take control of mighty group of heroes separated in 2 teams, clashing in head-to-head fights, all in an attempt to wreak enough havoc on their opponent’s base and force them to surrender! Your army ranges from lowly creeps to powerful heroes, each with their own roles to fulfill. It is up to you to use their unique skills and abilities to best your foes on the open field. In LOAD you will coordinate attacks, daringly step through dangerous forest to reach other lanes and assist your heroes, all in attempt to reach opponent’s base and secure victory.

In 30-90 minutes, you will use abilities of your heroes by rolling dice to damage opponents heroes and base.

Heroes are represented by 32mm scale models and Lane creeps by 28mm scale models that are moved around the board to establish tactical dominance.

195548.name: Savage Races I
195548.description:
From publisher blurb:

Since the release of the first bestiary, the first monster book, there have been those who asked - can I play something exotic, can I play a monster instead of a regular character?

In this release of the Monster Classes series, you have the opportunity to play as one of several savage species - the bugbear, gnoll, or ogre! As a member of these savage races, your experience playing in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game is sure to be unique and filled with unexpected situations.

This book includes three monster classes - the bugbear, gnoll, and ogre, along with the associated feats necessary to build interesting characters, that at the same time are true to the concept presented in the Bestiary.

195549.name: The Blood is the Life
195549.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Vampire Class for Basic Era Games

Vampires…
They have haunted our myths and legends since time began.

They have been a staple of role-playing villains, monsters, and anti-heroes since the dawn of the role-playing hobby.

Now you can play these fearsome monsters of horror tales in your Basic-Era style games.

Presented here is a full 20 level class with all the classic vampiric powers.

Fully compatible with the vampire monsters you have been using for nearly 40 years.

195550.name: The Play's the Thing (5E)
195550.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 5th Edition compatible adventure for four to six PCs of Levels 4-5
Naytella, a goddess of revelry and relaxed pleasure, had few shrines. Authorities feared what they couldn’t control and her belief in freedom of spirit worried many, causing them to drive her scattered followers underground. So when the bard Villeim Teatteri discovers an ancient site dedicated to Naytella, he knows what he must do; convert an entire town to her calling! But how to do that, and where to start? Everyone likes to see a good show and have a chance to share a drink or three with new friends, so Teatteri and his theatrical troupe set out to ensure both of these happen. But more is going on behind the scenes than meets the eye, and a voice of dissent asks the PCs to help restore order. It’s time to step forward and face the music for the party, as they find out that the play’s the thing to catch the conscience when adventuring!
Also included in “The Play’s the Thing”:

Cartography by 3x ENnie award winner Todd Gamble
A new prestige class – the Companion of Naytella
New Spell: Influence
New Magic Items; Flyers of Influence and Posters of Influence
New Monster: Material Golem
“At your finger tips” NPC information on one page per level

195551.name: Heart of the Sacred Dawn (Pathfinder)
195551.description:
From publisher blurb:

For four to five level 20 PCs

In ages past the realm was plunged into an age of darkness beneath the terrible wrath of Tenebrash, vile lord of dragons. His evil had no mortal equal, and hopeless lament was the only bounty of his subjects. For generations the tyrant ruled unopposed until the Order of the Sacred Dawn challenged his cruelty. By the charge of a powerful and benevolent deity, six holy knights were bestowed with an artifact of tremendous power. Wielding the relic known as the lucespel, the order vanquished Tenebrash and light was returned to the weary world. The knights bound the vengeful spirit of the dragon within their stronghold, and sacrificed their own mortality to eternally guard the artifact from those who would misuse its power. With the return of evil to the realm, a new quest has been called: venture into the ruins of the ancient keep to retrieve the lucespel. Those who seek to harness its holy essence will face the ultimate challenge to prove both their valor and virtue.

195552.description: A promo character for use in both King of Tokyo and King of New York originally available as a reward in the 2016 Dice Tower Season 12 Kickstarter
195552.name: King of Tokyo/King of New York: Iron Rook

195554.name: Ninja Camp: Kitten
195554.description:
A promo card originally available as a reward through the 2016 Dice Tower Season 12 Kickstarter. Later available with Kodama funded through Kickstarter.

Kitten: Move three spaces, claiming the card you moved from and both cards you moved over. Put your ninja on its side. It cannot be moved by you for the rest of the game.

195555.name: Mage Wars Academy/Mage Wars: Arena Dice Tower Promo 2016
195555.description:
A pack of 8 promo cards that can be used with either Mage Wars Academy or Mage Wars: Arena originally available as a reward in the 2016 Dice Tower Season 12 Kickstarter.

Promo Cards:


Bound Healing
Cowardice
Miss
Royal Armorer
Sanctuary
Servant of Malacoda
Silverclaw Ratel
Stench of Death

195556.description:
Two promo tiles originally available as a reward in the 2016 Dice Tower Season 12 Kickstarter.

Phoenix and Turtle
195556.name: Onitama: Phoenix and Turtle
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Good, The Board and The SORRY SORRY SORRY SORRY SORRY: Episode 66 “

195557.description:
A promo card originally available as a reward through the 2016 Dice Tower Season 12 Kickstarter.

Security Craft

Faction: Trade Federation
Cost: 4
Primary Ability: Combat (4) Authority (3)
Ally Ability: (Trade Federation) Trade (3)
195557.name: Star Realms: Security Craft Promo Card

195558.name: Lanterns: The Harvest Festival Dice Tower Promo Tile
195558.description: A promo tile originally available as a reward through the 2016 Dice Tower Kickstarter.

195559.name: Scheherazade: The Sultan's Palace
195559.description:
User summary:

In this storytelling game, the role of game master passes from player to player with frequency. The game master, or "primary storyteller" narrates the overall story; the remaining players assume the characters of significance and narrate their own actions. At any point, a character may interrupt the current story to tell one of their own in a "nested storytelling" event; once the story-in-a-story concludes the interrupted story resumes. A set of customized character cards is used to spur creativity (ten sample cards are provided). A timer may be used to limit the length of various stories, though this is optional. Finally, a large number of tokens is used to control access to significant narrative input (to assure all players get a roughly equal time in the spotlight).

195560.description:
In Wasteland Express Delivery Service, you take on the role of drivers inhabiting a post-apocalyptic wasteland riddled with outrageous, unhinged, and otherworldly characters who are set on unleashing mayhem at every turn.

To survive in this deranged universe, drivers must haul food, water, and guns between the handful of settlements pockmarked through the wasteland. You must battle insane raiders who occupy the void between cities, taking on missions from the three factions that have divided up the last of civilization: the fascist New Republic Army, is hellbent on bringing the world to heel for its own good; the heretical Oracles of Ceres, who have turned their attention to the worship of the land; and the technologically obsessed Archivists, who cling to the old ways and the hope of restoring our lost civilization.

But what do you care? You're here to get paid and live another day free. Outfit your truck, hire some insane riders to help fend off raiders, add some storage, and just keep truckin'.

Wasteland Express Delivery Service includes an emergent narrative story that unfolds over the course of 10 sessions. Each scenario begins with a beautifully illustrated comic book introduction that sets up the storyline and the constantly escalating stakes and challenges in front of players. Alternatively, players can dive in with a randomly generated scenario that will play out over the course of a single story-driven game session.
195560.name: Wasteland Express Delivery Service
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 20 - Geekway Games And Animal Facts
Episode 4 - A New Hope (Gen Con Preview)
Episode 53 - Terra Mystica
WDYPTW Conversation Thing Ep 95.13

195561.description:
CREATE your wizard deck from a combination of spell, race & treasure cards.

ADVENTURE board game or RPG-style!

IMPROVE your wizard deck with epic loot and advanced spells.

---

Young Wizards is a card-based tabletop RPG/board game where each player assumes the role of a... Well... A Young Wizard.

Each player constructs a deck of cards representing their spells, equipment and other features (like race). That deck can grow more powerful over time as the player adventures into twisting caverns and dark forests, discovering treasures & gaining experience.

All of that sounds great, and can be done with other tabletop RPGs. How does Young Wizards differ?


The game can be played without a Game Master(GM)/Dungeon Master for a more "board game" feel.
If played with a GM, setting up adventures & encounters is a breeze, leaving you more time to focus on your story.
More schools of magic than you can shake a wand at. Deck-builders rejoice! (of course, we have deck pre-constructions for the wee ones)
The card-based approach provides the perfect "bridge" between younger players and the deeper world of tabletop RPGs / board games.
195561.name: Young Wizards

195562.name: Skylar & Plux: Adventure on Clover Island
videogamehonor: 2015 Swedish Game Awards Best Execution in Art Winner
2015 Swedish Game Awards Game of the Year Winner
195562.description:
User Summary

The game sets two unlikely heroes on an adventure to prevent the villainous CRT from conquering their home and turning it into a wasteland.

195566.description:
An action card for Fluxx: The Board Game. It reads:

Action - play + discard
Scramble Colors

Gather up all color cards currently in use, shuffle them together, and deal them back out.

You must do this either before or after you make all of your moves.
195566.name: Fluxx: The Board Game – Scramble Colors

195567.name: Driving School Simulator
195567.description:
User Summary

Choose between driving a traditional car, bus, or truck and prepare to navigate city streets, mountain roads, or scenic highways.

195568.name: Cheese Burglers
195568.description:
Who'd want to be a mouse? There's so little cheese around, and mousetraps are everywhere!
Not only that, enemy mice are afoot, armed to the teeth with crossbows, plasma grenades, shotguns, flamethrowers, bazookas, evil space lasers and a host of special powers!
In the fast-paced card game Cheese Or Die, players take on the role of mice competing to horde the most cheese, whilst arming up in a bid to steal cheese from their opponents. Will you take your chances and draw from the Cheese Deck - a deck which becomes increasingly 'dangerous' as the game goes on - or play the long game by collecting weapons and bonuses, and smashing your rivals in combat?

To win, you'll need to be ruthless and pick your fights carefully.
Oh, and avoid proximity mines...

In Cheese Or Die, the first player to collect 6 cheese cards wins... but this can be difficult! To do this, players can attack opponents by choosing a weapon card from their hand, adding any bonuses, and playing any number of special cards on top. Expect brutal fights with lots of surprises! Special cards allow you to alter the normal victory conditions of the game, or mess with your opponents' combat total, for example. Only if attackers win can they draw a card from the defender's cheese cards. Just don't draw a mine!

There's also the Cheese Deck, which has its own dynamics. Players can take a chance and draw directly from this deck, or set traps for their opponents by looking ahead and loading the deck.

All in all this is a fast, fun and tense card game that provides some hilarious moments!

195569.description:
Timeline: Cannes & Cinema is a card game played using 55 cards. Each card depicts a Movie on both sides, with the year in which that movie was selected at the Cannes Film Festival occurred on only one side. Players take turns placing a card from their hand in a row on the table. After placing the card, the player reveals the date on it. If the card was placed correctly with the date in chronological order with all other cards on the table, the card stays in place; otherwise the card is removed from play and the player takes another card from the deck.

The first player to get rid of all his cards by placing them correctly wins. If multiple players go out in the same round, then everyone else is eliminated from play and each of those players are dealt one more card for another round of play. If only one player has no cards after a bonus round, he wins; otherwise play continues until a single player goes out.

Timeline: Cannes & Cinema can be combined with any other title in the Timeline series.

Contains 55 cards in French and 55 cards (the same) in English.
boardgameversion: Limited edition for Cannes Game Fair (FIJ)
195569.name: Timeline: Cannes & Cinema

195570.name: No Feet to Follow Us, No Hands to Strike Us
195570.description:
From publisher blurb:

A one-shot adventure for the GUMSHOE system!

Greece, 1948. The civil war is raging, with Communist partisans waging a guerrilla war against the US-backed government and National Army. In the south of the Peloponnese, a British archaeologist is missing, presumed dead. In truth, he has fallen prey to one of the most terrifying creatures of Greek folklore.

The investigators are tasked with finding out what has happened to him. They may be:

Officers of the gendarmerie (the Chorofylaki) from Githeio, the nearest large town, or from Sparta, the provincial capital.
Private investigators retained by the well-to-do Martin family to locate their relative.
Friends of Martin concerned about him enough to travel to Greece.




This product includes:

At the End of the Corridor: A short story by Evangeline Walton, originally published in Weird Tales.
No Feet to Follow Us, No Hands to Strike Us: The GUMSHOE scenario described above, a sequel to the story.
Information on the vrykolakas - the undead monster of Greek folk legend.
A complimentary copy of Against the Unknown, the low-prep GUMSHOE game.

boardgameimplementation: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game
boardgameintegration: Legendary Encounters: A Predator Deck Building Game
Legendary Encounters: An Alien Deck Building Game
Legendary Encounters: A Predator Deck Building Game
Legendary Encounters: An Alien Deck Building Game
boardgamehonor: 2016 Golden Geek Best Cooperative Game Nominee
195571.description:
In Legendary Encounters: Firefly, players take on the roles of characters from the series and work together to complete objectives for episodes from the Firefly TV show. Players each select an Avatar out of the Main Characters of the game. Each game will have 5 Main Characters and 4 Supporting Characters, so all 9 crew members will be part of each game. The 14-card stack for each Supporting Character is shuffled together to form the Crew Deck, which will be used to build up each player's deck.

Legendary Encounters: A Firefly Deck Building Game is a standalone game in the Legendary Encounters series that utilizes the Legendary Encounters system set in the Firefly universe. Build up your deck, coordinate with your crew, and upgrade your ship to gain advantages, but be careful that Serenity does not too many ship strikes. Get ready to explore the 'Verse!
195571.name: Legendary Encounters: A Firefly Deck Building Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 000 (2016) – Top 25 Games
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 027 – End of Year One
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 035 – Top 25 of 2016
DoxCast #142: Board Games: eXamining 4X

TGT 003: Legendary Encounters – Firefly
The Game Pit Podcast: Episode 61 - 2016 Treasure Hunt Part 1

195572.name: Sector Forty-Four
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
195572.description:
From publisher blurb:

The exploration of "Deep Space" continues.

Welcome to Sector Forty-Four, the home system of the Lomisians. Here you'll find their homeworld, and many of the worlds they've colonized. You'll also find worlds that have been taken from the Lomisians. Plus you'll find worlds that even the Lomisians avoid, and damaged systems that are a danger to all, but a challenge for the brave.

195573.name: Gorgon (ICONS)
195573.description:
From publisher blurb:

What's an archaeologist with a penchant for lining his pockets to do when he finds an ancient mask that appears to call to him? Once he donned the mask, everything changed in the life of Stefon Pulos. He was powerful and now had the ability to take what he wanted in life. Can your heroes convince him otherwise?

195574.name: Jungle Terrors
195574.description:
From publisher blurb:

BLOOD-CHILLING HORROR IN THE STEAMY JUNGLE...

Jungle Terrors brings together great comic book story-telling, pulp-style action, and supernatural horror in four great tales from Alan Hewetson (Lady Satan 1974), Matt Baker (News Hounds), and Jack Kamen (Rulah: Jungle Goddess). Inspired by this mix of elements, game designer Steve Miller has created a new monster for OGL d20 campaigns, as well as a simple add-on to OGL d20 Modern character generation that will let you make heroes who carry within them the legacy of Atlantis and other lost civilizations and races.

Jungle Terrors continues the saga of Jane Dodge that began in Rulah: Jungle Goddess, while expanding upon the history of Atlantis that's bgeen touched upon in Secrets of the Immortals and other NUELOW Games releases. Neither of these previous books are needed for you to gain full enjoyment of this one.

195575.name: Numenera Artifact Deck
195575.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the Ninth World, artifacts are items of ancient mystery and power. Compared to cyphers, they're relatively permanent and often have straightforward applications. But their workings are incomprehensible—a device powered by transdimensional siphons using nanotechnology to rewrite reality on the subatomic level often appears more magic than machine.

The Numenera Artifact Deck contains 100 new artifacts that haven't appeared in any previous publication. Whether you're looking for a little inspiration as you prep for your game, or need to come up with a artifact on the fly during play, simply draw a card. There's an image of the artifact on one side and complete description and game content on the reverse.

195576.name: Eternal Mage
195576.description:
From publisher blurb:

With the arcane power of Eternity, nothing can stand in your way!

New from Purple Duck Games, the amazing arcane spellcaster class of the eternal mage in Legendary Classes: Eternal Mage by N. Jolly! Eternal mages are not limited by memorizing spells, like wizards, or “spells per day” like other spontaneous classes- if they can manage the strain on their own arcane wellspring of power, there is no limit to the manifestations of power they can produce! Legendary Classes: Eternal Mage includes full class description for a 20-level class, many “eternal secrets” for customizing the powers for your eternal mage, 3 archetypes to choose from such as artillery expert, dread eternal and master specialist, a prepared 1st level sample character, and favored class bonuses from all of the races promoted by the Lands of Porphyra campaign setting!

195581.name: Path of War Expanded
195581.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Path of War continues onward!

Inside the pages of this tome, your options for martial characters more than double! Within Path of War Expanded you will find more maneuvers, stances, and feats for your existing martial disciples as well as a host of new options! There are new classes, archetypes, martial traditions, and even the new class template that provides a way to use a single archetype for different character classes.

Path of War Expanded contains:

Three new base classes, from the ill-omened harbinger, to the psychic zealot, and finally the arcane mystic who all mix supernatural elements into their martial combat styles.
Nine new martial disciplines like Cursed Razor, Eternal Guardian, and Sleeping Goddess
A host of archetypes for the three original classes from Path of War and the three new classes from Path of War Expanded
Martial archetypes for core and psionic classes, including options for the Aegis, Dread, and Marksman classes from Ultimate Psionics
Class templates, which provides archetypes that work across multiple classes
Martial style feats for all the different disciplines, including those originally found in Path of War like Iron Tortouise and Solar Wind
More than a dozen new martial traditions
And new and optional rules and clarifications to martial combat that will take your martial characters to a whole new level!




Come and enjoy the spoils of battle with Path of War Expanded!

195582.name: The Stalker
195582.description:
From publisher blurb:

Let slip the hounds of war!

A tireless warrior, using an almost precognitive understanding of battles, the stalker hunts his prey with the help of advanced martial disciplines and deadly maneuvers. Included in this book is the complete maneuver combat system, the stalker base class, five martial disciplines with hundreds of strikes, counters, boosts and stances, and new feats!

Path of War is a series of releases focused on a maneuver-based combat system, with the stalker being the first class to be released.

195583.name: The Warlord
195583.description:
From publisher blurb:

Let slip the hounds of war!

The striking leader, the fearless captain, the bold chieftain. All inspiring warrior who lead their forces from the front of the battlefield, the warlord is a warrior who aids his allies through tactical maneuvers and incredible daring. Included in this book is the complete maneuver combat system, the warlord base class, five martial disciplines with hundreds of strikes, counters, boosts, and stances, and new feats!

195584.name: The Warder
195584.description:
From publisher blurb:

Let slip the hounds of war!

The rock upon which the sea breaks. The shield that stops the horde. The flash of lightning steel that deflects the killing blow. The warder is all of these and many more. He is the guardian who keeps his allies alive. In this installment of Path of War you will find the warder base class, four martial disciplines with a multitude of strikes, counters, boosts, and stances, new feats, and the complete maneuver combat system!

Path of War is a series of releases focused on a maneuver-based combat system, with the warder being the protector and tactician of The Path of War.

195585.name: Supplemental Content
195585.description:
From publisher blurb:

This installment of the Path of War contains the final content before consolidating all four parts into a single tome of martial combat support!

Included in this 25-page book you will find:

Archetypes for each of the Path of War base classes (the stalker, warder, and warlord), including the soulhunter, the dervish defender, and the steelfist commando!
New feats for characters using maneuvers, such as Discipline Expertise, Martial Power, and Victorious Recovery
Five new prestige classes using maneuvers, including
The Battle Templar, a divine combatant who blends maneuvers with holy power
The Blade Caster, who learns to use his arcane energy to augment his combat expertise
The Dragon Fury, a dual-wielding warrior who dances to the tune of the dragon war god
The Mage Hunter, the scourge of arcane casters who blends martial combat with stealth to slay mages
And the Umbral Blade, who has a connection to the Plane of Shadow and transforms his very blade into a weapon of darkness

195586.description:
A deck of 9 Scenario cards used for changing the way Evolution is played.

To use these cards, you draw one card at random from the scenario deck, and the rule described on it is in force for the entire game.
195586.name: Evolution: Scenario Cards

195589.name: Alienòr
195589.description:
(publisher blurb)

This is a storygame about the ladies-in-waiting to Eleanor of Aquitaine, an intriguing medieval queen. Around this queen a hidden women's culture emerged—subtle, intangible, poetic and not less passionate. In the middle of it is the capricious and unfathomable Queen. There's no getting around her. Hidden in the silk folds of history, this world has its own stories. Now it is up to you to tell those stories, together.

rpgseries: Mortars & Miniguns: Modern and Magical Weapons for Fifth Edition Games
195590.name: Zane's Guide to Pistols
195590.description:
From publisher blurb:

The definitive sourcebook for introducing modern and magical pistols to your Fifth Edition games! Whether you plan to run a modern-era game, a techno-fantasy campaign or just need to introduce a few alien relics from an advanced, forgotten civilisation, this book has you covered. Assembled by the eccentric but nevertheless brilliant dwarf explorer and gun aficionado Zane Ironheart, the Guide to Pistols features:

Simple rules for handling firearms in Fifth Edition, including ammo, malfunctions, burst fire and autofire.
7 basic pistol models to get you started. Go with an Autoloader, a traditional Six-shooter or trust in the power and precision of an One-shot Express.
25 magical pistols, from uncommon guns with useful abilities all the way up to legendary pistols that will shake the entire battlefield. Incinerate your enemies with the Firestarter. Blast them to pieces with the Ruinous Bolter. Bring law to the lawless with the Righteous Judge.
New feats, a new fighting style and a new martial archetype for pistol-wielding fighters.

rpgseries: Mortars & Miniguns: Modern and Magical Weapons for Fifth Edition Games
195591.name: A 5E Primer to Pistols
195591.description:
From publisher blurb:

All the open game content of Zane's Guide to Pistols in a convenient PDF! Contains the basic rules for firearms in Fifth Edition games as well as 7 common pistols with full stats, from the popular Autoloader to the fearsome Hand Cannon.

rpgseries: Mortars & Miniguns: Modern and Magical Weapons for Fifth Edition Games
195592.name: A 5E Primer to Rifles
195592.description:
From publisher blurb:

All the open game content of Zane's Guide to Rifles in a convenient PDF! Contains the basic rules for firearms in Fifth Edition games as well as 5 common rifles with full stats, from the standard Assault Rifle to the mighty Fifty Cal. Also included are 4 magical rifles to spice up your games: the Angry Zeus, Chain Reaction, Emerald Seer and Zeta Fantastic Mark One.

rpgseries: Mortars & Miniguns: Modern and Magical Weapons for Fifth Edition Games
195593.name: Zane's Guide to Rifles
195593.description:
From publisher blurb:

The definitive sourcebook for introducing modern and magical rifles to your Fifth Edition games! Whether you plan to run a modern-era game, a techno-fantasy campaign or just need to introduce a few alien relics from an advanced, forgotten civilisation, this book has you covered. Assembled by the eccentric but nevertheless brilliant dwarf explorer and gun aficionado Zane Ironheart, the Guide to Rifles features:

Simple rules for handling firearms in Fifth Edition, including ammo, malfunctions, burst fire and autofire.
5 basic rifle models to get you started. Get an Assault rifle, a fearsome Battle rifle or the mighty Fifty-Cal.
20 magical rifles, from uncommon guns with useful abilities all the way up to legendary rifles that will shake the entire battlefield. Dissolve your enemies with the Painful Odyssey. Hunt them down with the Pack Hunter. Dominate the battlefield with the Zeta Fantastic Mark One.
A new feat, a new fighting style and a new archetype for sniper rangers.

rpgseries: Mortars & Miniguns: Modern and Magical Weapons for Fifth Edition Games
195594.name: Zane's Guide to Shotguns
195594.description:
From publisher blurb:

Everybody knows that a shotgun is the best weapon against a horde of zombies, but what about when you're faced an orc invasion or a rampaging dragon? The good news is that a shotgun works against all of them! The even better news is that you can now introduce these fearsome weapons in your Fifth Edition games with this comprehensive guide.

Simple rules for handling firearms in Fifth Edition, including ammo, malfunctions, burst fire and autofire.
6 basic shotgun models to get you started. Get a Pump Shotgun, a classic Double-barreled or attach an Underbarrel shotgun to your favorite rifle.
20 magical shotguns, from uncommon guns with useful abilities all the way up to legendary shotguns that will shake the entire battlefield. Carve up your enemies with the Butcher. Freeze and shatter them with the Frost Hammer. Feel the rage with the Rageorade.
New feats, a new fighting style and a new primal path for barbarians.

rpgseries: Mortars & Miniguns: Modern and Magical Weapons for Fifth Edition Games
195595.name: A 5E Primer to Shotguns
195595.description:
From publisher blurb:

All the open game content of Zane's Guide to Shotguns in a convenient PDF! Contains the basic rules for firearms in Fifth Edition games as well as 6 common shotguns with full stats, from the popular Pump Shotgun to the badass Sawed-off Shotgun. Also includes 4 magical shotguns: the Butcher, Cold Snap, Incredible Gemini and Widowmaker.

rpgseries: Mortars & Miniguns: Modern and Magical Weapons for Fifth Edition Games
195596.name: A 5E Primer to Machine Guns
195596.description:
From publisher blurb:

All the open game content of Zane's Guide to Machine Guns in a convenient PDF! Contains the basic rules for firearms in Fifth Edition games as well as 5 common machine guns with full stats, from the portabler Submachine Gun to the awesome Minigun. Also includes 4 magical machine guns: the Fearless Guardian, Grand Inquisitor, Infiltrator and Splitfire.

rpgseries: Mortars & Miniguns: Modern and Magical Weapons for Fifth Edition Games
195597.name: Zane's Guide to Machine Guns
195597.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not enough dakka? Bring the joy of automatic fire to your Fifth Edition Games with the ultimate guide to machine guns.

Simple rules for handling firearms in Fifth Edition, including ammo, malfunctions, burst fire and autofire.
5 basic machine gun models to get you started. Get a small and agile Submachine Gun, a support Light Machine Gun or wield the fearsome Minigun.
20 magical machine guns, from uncommon guns with useful abilities all the way up to legendary automatic weapons that will shake the entire battlefield. Gain an extra team member with the Fearsome Guardian, incinerate your enemies with the Hellfire or decimate an entire charge of orc warriors with the Ferocious Claymore.
New feats, a new fighting style and a new martial archetype for fighters.

195598.name: Mnemonic Ghosts
195598.description:
User summary:

Characters in this unusual and intriguing game are "ghosts" who have give up (or lost) their physical bodies and now work as possessors, taking over the bodies of others to pursue their own goals. One of the more intriguing aspects of the game involves the morality of the characters' actions.

Ghosts (characters) have three Attributes (Heart, Senses, Wits) that have a numeric value (1-5) assigned from a points pool. They also have Skills with numeric values (1-8, at creation) assigned from another points pool. Characters also have Affinities with values and a Pools structure for holding resolution dice in one or more pools. These values may interact with the host's values depending upon the situation. Various descriptions of the levels of ability are provided.

195599.name: Punch Club
195599.description:
Punch Club is a strategy / tycoon / streetfighter-manager game with 80-90s atmosphere, nostalgia and lots of games/movies references.

You have to manage your time and money to improve your fighter skills on one side and your training equipment on the other. You will start as an unknown fighter in the underground club and must work your way to the top and solve the mystery from your past.

Improve your characteristics, learn new fight moves and unlock new abilities in the skill tree. Make your setup for every fight to suit the particular situation and opponent.

Choose your way wisely. Every decision matters. You can be a super-hero, a criminal or waste your life watching TV, or even run your own gym.

The game is a mix of a non-linear storyline, a tycoon-like gameplay, RPG elements and a tactical fight.

Source: The Developer Website.

195604.name: Nothing Sacred
195604.description:
User summary:

The game centers around trying to determine which of the characters is guilty of a murder. The game is subtitled a "youdunit" because every character, during creation, is assumed to be the guilty party. A character's backstory must include enough incriminating and contradictory data to "prove" they are guilty of the murder - if the information can be discovered by other characters during play. The game proceeds in scenes with players taking turns as the primary narrator for a scene.

Characters have three Attributes: Brains, Beauty, and Braun [sic]. These have a "Stat" or numeric rating. Characters also have various other Traits that allow them to investigate and find out about other character's secrets. Action resolution uses a dice pool that yields a success count.

Note the game author/submitter was known only as "secret" on the forums. The game was entered as an text file.

195607.name: Palace of Mental Hygiene
195607.description:
From the introduction:

Officially, the Palace of Mental Hygiene represents the government’s dedication to the welfare of its citizens. Officially, it is a place dedicated to helping the mentally ill and the socially maladjusted heal and become happy, contributing members of society. Officially, no one is sent there who does not need help. However, now you know the truth. You know that you are not mentally ill. You know that your only social maladjustment was daring to question the government’s will. You know these things now. The only question is, how long will you be able to remember them.

195608.name: Reminders (2007)
195608.description:
From the introduction:

Characters in the game are defined by Attributes (Body, Mind, and Balance, with values distributed from a points pool) and a variety of derived Attributes. Characters also have three dice pools derived from Attributes: Corpus, Psyche, and Pax. Damage causes a reduction in Attributes; Attribute damage and expended points pools are regained through rest. Action resolution uses a dice pool mechanism.

The game supposes that characters' primary activities will be combat and violence. The combat mechanics dominate the rules. In addition to notable physical prowess, characters have advanced mental capabilities that allow them to use supernatural powers (most of them centered on combat).

This game was published to an online competition forum without any author identification.

195609.description: McClellan Moves expands Grant's Gamble, allowing players to recreate the Peninsula Campaign. Included in this game is units for Johnston, McClellan, siege guns, and the CSS Virginia. Rules for Antietam might come out with a future expansion.
195609.name: McClellan Moves

195611.name: Donjon (2002)
195611.description:
User summary:

Donjon uses characters with race, class, and attributes. Characters gain experience and "level up" in their class. Action resolution uses a dice pool of d20s against a target number.

This version of the game is provided under a creative commons license and is free to access online. The system has a somewhat lighthearted feel but is well developed and balanced.

195612.name: Demons with Shotguns
195612.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Demons with Shotguns is the ultimate couch fragger gibfest! Armed with a powerful shotgun, bullet deflecting shield and power-up tarot cards, 2 to 4 local players will battle it out to collect each others souls in 9 different competitive game modes across 4 realms & 40 arenas.

Source: The Developer Website.

195613.name: Department Nine
195613.description:
From the introduction:

1.1 Welcome to Department Nine and Preliminary Briefing

Congratulations on being hired to work for FATE's subdivision, Department Nine. As you by now know, FATE is responsible for the management and control of the destinies of every major lifeform on Earth, and has liaisons with extraterrestrial [REDACTED].

Many new applicants have substantial questions concerning the nature of FATE and why the division exists. These questions will be answered in the "Questions From New Recruits" section (see page [REDACTED]).

195614.name: Know Thyself
195614.description:
From the introduction:


You don’t quite know who or what you’re playing when the game begins, because you don’t create a character beforehand. The player of the Amnesiac doesn't create a character before the game; he creates it during the game. The other players don’t create characters at all, but "choose" or "force" characters during the game.



This game is meant to be played in one session between three to five friends.



This game uses a custom poker deck for many different purposes – to determine who wins when some sort of conflict occurs, but also to determine what characters people can play, where events occur, and what themes to incorporate into latter parts of the game. In this way, it is a hybrid between a role-playing game and a card game.

195615.name: Know Thyself: Cards
195615.description:
User summary:

While the game can be played with a stripped pack of French playing cards, this would frequently require looking up every card on one or more tables to determine game effect. This print-and-play accessory provides cards with all game data, including special graphics, on ever unique card.

195616.name: Medieval Playground
195616.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

First person view. Set forth into the world and look around. Gather resources. Dig holes and caves and build buildings. Create a settlement. Decorate your creations. Start wars and fires. Place animals and trees. Build alliances.

195617.name: Nitroplus Blasterz: Heroines Infinite Duel
videogamehonor: 2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Mutliplayer Experience of the Year Nominee
195617.description:
Nitroplus Blasterz: Heroines Infinite Duel (ニトロプラス ブラスターズ -ヒロインズ インフィニット デュエル- Nitoropurasu Burasutāzu: Heroinzu Infinitto Dueru?) is a fighting game developed by Examu and published by Nitroplus. The game crosses over heroines from various visual novels and games released by Nitroplus, as well as those from manga and anime series that Nitroplus writers have been involved with. The game was released in arcades on April 30, 2015 and was released on PlayStation 3 and PlayStation 4 in collaboration with Marvelous Entertainment's Marvelous Inc. on December 10, 2015. Marvelous USA published the game in North America in February 2, 2016. It is the sequel to the doujin game Nitro+ Royale: Heroines Duel.

The game uses five buttons; light attack, medium attack, heavy attack, escape action, and heavy action. The escape action button can be used to perform evasive maneuvers and guards while heavy actions can be used to push an opponent back. Players can perform Infinite Blasts, which can interrupt an opponent's attack, Variable Rushes, which allows for surprise combos, and Lethal Blazes, which serve as the game's super combo attacks. Players can also choose two support characters which they can summon to assist them.

There are 32 characters which are split up into playable characters and support characters. Super Sonico was initially a support character, but was later made playable. An original character, who is a dark palette swap and final boss version of Al Azif, Al Azif Ex Mortis is the non-playable final boss of the game, created by Mugen Yoguruma, act as a copy of the Necronomicon, crafted from the fragments of the Al Azifs from the infinite universes in which Demonbane failed. At the end of the story mode, Ex Mortis is defeated and absorbed by Al Azif, whom gains all of Ex Mortis' memories, as well as the completion of her soul.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nitroplus_Blasterz%3A_Heroines_Infinite_Duel Nitroplus Blasterz: Heroines Infinite Duel]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

195618.name: Anachrocosmic
195618.description:
From the introduction:

Anachrocosmic is a standard roleplaying game with some not-so-standard rules. True, you have players and an optional GM, you roll dice to determine outcomes, and you have stats to keep track of, but this is not a game about developing a character and making moral decisions. This is a game about combat and blowing stuff up... with style.

User summary:

A game master is used if the group wants to focus more on roleplaying than using the rules primarily as a combat simulator. The game setting is well developed.

195619.name: Head Spaces!
195619.description:
From the game:


Intellectual trips are tied to Authority hang-ups
Creative trips are tied to Materialism hang-ups
Sensual trips are tied to Conformity hang-ups
Spiritual trips are tied to Negativity hang-ups


User summary:

Characters in the excelsior and far-out game are defined by rather free-form narrative tags and descriptions. They have hang-ups of one sort or another and they like to have several kinds of trips - some good, some bad. Action resolution uses dice pools. Wrap your head around that, daddy-o! Game can be played on "shrooms".

195620.name: Take Back of Freedom: FIRE CHRONICLE
rpg: Take Back of Freedom: FIRE CHRONICLE
195620.description:
User summary:

The game is set in a near-future dystopian America where the White House has been replaced by the White Palace. The characters use mecha to fight against the powers of tyranny. The game setting and concept are derived from a video game of a similar nature.

Characters have several traits, which are narrative tags. They are all randomly generated. The game primarily uses d6 in dice pools but also retains a d12 as a somewhat central mechanic. The rules are not easily understood in several sections.

boardgamecompilation: Tiny Epic Kingdoms: Heroes' Call – Deluxe Promo Pack and Mini Expansion
195621.description:
Deluxe edition of Tiny Epic Kingdoms: Heroes' Call, containing three more factions (Imps, Ooze and Insectoids) and a mini-expansion (Keys of Aughmoore Exploration Tiles).

The war continues and spreads further and further. New factions have arrived from the north igniting more epic battles than before. Heroes rise over the fallen bodies of their enemies. Kingdoms spread across the frozen wastelands in search of silver. War Towers grow taller than the trees. Who will be victorious in the end?

Tiny Epic Kingdoms: Heroes' Call introduces heroes to the war. Heroes will bring to play a variety of benefits unique to their class. Players will use a larger meeple to represent the hero of their faction.

Additionally new mechanisms are introduced to the building action of the game. This will have players tracking their tower progress by placing tower cubes onto regions they possess. Players are encouraged to keep these tower cubes safe because losing them in war results in a loss of progress on the tower card.

Furthermore Tiny Epic Kingdoms: Heroes' Call introduces a slew of new factions, new regions with new mechanisms and a new resource type, and even brings solo play to Tiny Epic Kingdoms!

The lore of Tiny Epic Kingdoms: Heroes' Call occurs after Tiny Epic Kingdoms and before Tiny Epic Defenders.
195621.name: Tiny Epic Kingdoms: Heroes' Call Deluxe Edition
boardgameaccessory: Tiny Epic Kingdoms: Heroes' Call – Playmat

195622.name: Bad Timing
195622.description:
From publisher blurb:

You find who might just be the one true love you are meant to have. But finding that person and living the rest of your life with that person might not be as easy as you think, given this is all a huge case of bad timing. This is the Fiasco Romantic Comedy playset you never knew you were waiting for.
