195739.description: A trivia game for the globetrotters ! Like the other games in the Fin Finaud family, you don't have to know the answer but rather guess who's going to be right or wrong. The game consists of 400 question cards related to geography, nearly the half on the countries, their capitals, flags, continent, and the other half on the world in general.

195740.name: Hallux Rigidus: The Encounter
195740.description:
Objective
It's basic math; adding and subtracting to achieve a specific value. In this case an 18, which gains the group access to another room, until they are able to escape all five rooms and finally exit the mansion to the freedom without.

Starting The Game
If Jane is present at this game, she always goes first, otherwise the oldest player starts and the turns continue clockwise.
Jane (or the oldest player) rolls the dice adding them together, she records the final number in the first box of her score-pad. (Example: 5, 5, 3 = 13 in the box.)
The goal is to reach the number 18 but without going over. To gain access to the next room the exact value of 18 must be attained. Since on the first roll an 18 can only be gained by rolling triple sixes most players will just write their total on the score-pad and the turn goes to the next player (clock-wise).

Each player in turn does the same.

In the event a triple six is rolled; when achieving an 18 all players move forward one room. Additionally any player who rolls a triple number can move to the next room (alone). The player who rolls triple sixes gets to move once with the group and once alone (two room advancement).

The Zombie
Whenever someone rolls ones (one, two or three ones), the zombie is advanced on the track. The roll of one or two ones, the zombie moves forward once but if triple ones are rolled the zombie moves forward twice.
The player continues their turn even when the zombie moves forward and the player finishes the turn before the zombie moves.

The track has the numbers 3, 2, and 1. Depending on the difficulty is where the zombie begins. 3 is the easiest because it takes longer for the zombie to travel across the track from 3 to 2 then to 1, before appearing in the attic of the mansion.

When the zombie is in the same room with any of the players, if ones are rolled, the zombie eats the flesh of the player with the lowest value on their score-pad (use one die to determine who is lowest when there is a tie).
It take a few rounds for the zombie to consume its victim before the allure of new flesh draws it off its current meal. This time is represented by returning the zombie back to his starting position.

Having your flesh gnawed by the zombie causes you to lose the game.

195741.name: Magus (Issue 12 - June 1992)
195741.description:
Contents:

Pelinjohtajan apulainen
Kotiinpaluu
Satamaan saapunutta
Kunnian etsijä
Tolkien Phenomenon
Metsien varjoissa kuolema kulkee
Mechwarrior-figuurit
Kirjepalsta

195742.name: The Godfather: A New Don
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 30 - Cry Havoc
Episode 32 - Holiday Gift Giving Guide
Episode 34 - 2016 Ding & Dent Awards Show!
195742.description:
In The Godfather: A New Don, players take control of one of the major mafia families, each trying to assert their power on the streets of 1950's New York in hope of taking the reins as the new kingpin of the criminal world.

In more detail, this design is an area control board game with unique dice mechanisms. Each round, players roll their individual pools of dice, then decide what area of the city they want to focus on trying to capture. Meanwhile, the current Don is able to make players an offer they can't refuse and steal dice from their limited supply. Staying on top proves difficult as every stolen die moves other players up the ladder toward taking over as Don, so the tension rises with each shake of the dice.

With multiple ways to use each die you roll, players never find themselves at the mercy of the dice, instead using what they roll to make their opponents beg for mercy.

195744.name: Tyranny
videogamehonor: 2016 Game Critics Best Role Playing Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Global Game Awards Best RPG of the Year Winner
195744.description:
In Tyranny, the grand war between good and evil is over – and the forces of evil, led by Kyros the Overlord, have won. The Overlord’s merciless armies dominate the face of the world, and its denizens must find their new roles within the war-torn realm. Players interact with the population of the populace to inspire loyalty, disgust, or fear as they roam the world as an officer in Kyros’ forces, empowered to act as both judge and executioner.

Features

A branching narrative with a unique story in an original setting: The Battle between good and evil has already taken place, and evil stands victorious.
Choices matter - a different player experience every time you play it - As an Officer in the Overlord’s army you wield a vast amount of power in the occupied lands of the Tiers. Will you use that power to inspire stability and loyalty, or will you be a feared oppressor?
Challenging, classic RPG combat with modern mechanics and presentation
A rich original setting - a completely new and original fantasy world with rich lore and many paths to follow

Source: The Publisher Website.

195745.name: Colt Express: Rock Promo Accessoir
195745.description:
A promo from the 2016 Easter Basket (Brettspiel Osternest).

It consists of a small folded board with the following instructions:

"This Rock decoration can be used to place your common deck during your Colt Express games, with or without the third expansion < Indians & Cavalry >, due to be released October 2016.

It's purely aesthetical and forms (just as the cardboard rocks and cactii) part of the scenery.

195746.name: Pathfinder Map Pack: Urban Sites
195746.description:
Publisher blurb:

Bright Lights, Big City

A thousand stories play out in grand apartments and shabby tenements throughout the city. When adventurers drop in on a society family's dinner or rescue a captive tied up in an abandoned flat, the Game Master shouldn't have to draw every parlor and back stair. This Pathfinder Map Pack provides beautifully illustrated 5" × 8" map tiles that can be combined into a variety of apartments and businesses. Inside, you'll find 18 richly crafted map tiles, including:

- Uptown Dining Room
- Scholar's Library
- Secret Safe House
- Elegant Flat
- Deserted Attic
- Tiny Apartment

Game Masters shouldn't waste their time sketching maps whenever characters venture downtown. With Pathfinder Map Pack: Urban Sites, you'll always have dangers ready when your adventures seek out the secrets of the city!

195747.name: WH1CH GAM3
195747.description:
WH1CH GAM3, a.k.a. W3LCH35 5P13L, is a small card game that can be used to determine which game your group should play next.

Each person chooses one game they wish to play, with the player who finished last in the previous game (or the host) choosing a second game. Place all of these games on the table. Each person draws a card at random, face down. The person with the lowest numbered card removes a game, then the person with the next lowest card removes a game, etc., until only one game remains on the table. Now it's time to play!

Multiple versions of WH1CH GAM3 have been published, all of which play the same and all of which have different sets of numbers in them. Shuffle one or more sets together to determine what to play when you have more than eight players on hand...

195748.name: Imperial Settlers: Council Promo
195748.description:
Originally available as a promo in the 2016 Easter Basket (Brettspiel Osternest).

The promo consists of a council board.

195749.name: Antarctica: Penguin Expansion
195749.description:
Originally available in the 2016 Easter Basket (Brettspiel Osternest).

A small expansion consisting of 8 penguin islands and rules to play.

195750.name: Haus Der Sonne: Lava Tiles Mini Expansion
195750.description:
Originally available through the 2016 Easter Basket (Brettspiel Osternest).

A mini expansion consisting of 6 lava tiles and rules to play.

195751.name: My Village: Vagrants Expansion
195751.description:
A small expansion originally available from the 2016 Easter Basket (Brettspiel Osternest).

The expansion consists of 4 vagrant tiles, 1 itinerant preacher tile and the rules to play.

195752.name: T.I.M.E Stories: Beacon Promo
195752.description:
Originally available in the 2016 Easter Basket (Brettspiel Osternest).

The promo consists of 3 Beacon tiles and the instructions on how to use them.

195753.name: Dream Islands: Package Trip Promo
195753.description:
A small promo originally available in the 2016 Easter Basket (Brettspiel Osternest).

The expansion consists of 12 tiles and the rules on how to use them.

195754.description: Bad Medicine: Second Opinion will include 100-150 new cards for Bad Medicine and a new mechanism that can add "surprise" cards to your pitch.
195754.name: Bad Medicine: Second Opinion
boardgamepodcastepisode: Breaking Bad....Medicine - Part 2
Episode 26: Star Wars Rebellion Review - Brawlers Maul
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 72!!

195755.description:
Originally available in the 2016 Easter Basket - egg #01 (Brettspiel Osternest).

The expansion consists of 9 wagon expansion tiles and the instructions on how to use them.
195755.name: Snowdonia:  Wagons Expansion

195756.name: A Matter of Reputation
195756.description:
From the front cover:

A Matter of Reputation
A One-round Shadowrun Virtual Seattle tournament

User summary:
The first ever Shadowrun Virtual Seattle scenario. According to the scenarie it could have been covered in about 1/3 of the pages, but since it's the first scenario for VS they wanted to include examples of how to run a VS scenario.

195757.name: Arcane Quest
195757.description:
Once again, the Empire is in trouble. Obscure forces infest the underground dungeons and threaten the peace of the upper world.
Plunge into the depths of darkness with your team of heroes and fight evil creatures to reach your goal. Courage, bravery, and intelligence will all be needed if you are to succeed.

In this classic-style board game, you can choose from 4 different heroes, each with different skills: warrior, wizard, dwarf or elf.
Collect gold, special items and new equipment to face the most challenging of enemies.
Use arcane spells or brute force, and carefully plan your strategy to succeed in your mission.

Source: The Developer Website.

195758.name: Old School Scifi: the Hacker Class
195758.description:
From publisher blurb:

Information warfare for White Star and other OSR games!

Ever wanted to play a computer genius who could devastate security and overload enemy weapons with but the click of a button or swipe of a touch screen? Want to misdirect and confuse with an array of holographic images and illusions? Then Old School Scifi: the Hacker Class is for you!

A new 10 level class!
Learn special techniques known as Exploits to harm and hinder enemy combatants and systems!
Sample systems for hacking and network security!
Equipment focused around covert operations such as cryptocurrency and encrypted links!




Enhance your White Star games today with a touch of digital warfare!

195759.name: New Fighter Maneuvers & Talents
195759.description:
From publisher blurb:

Become a Terror on the Battlefield!

Overwhelming focus on melee. Lack of out of combat options. Emphasis on mundane brute fighting without much versatility in style and feel. The Fighter class is a worthwhile option, but as one of the martial classes it doesn't have the diversity of the more complicated roles.

New Fighter Maneuvers & Talents is the remedy to these problems! Six new martial schools of related abilities are geared around unique fighting styles to lend a flair of coolness and versatility to every battle!

Become a daredevil scoundrel with Glimmering Cloak! Climb sheer surfaces in style with the Parkour talent, get your allies out of harm's way with Swinging Rescue, and other moves which would make the Three Musketeers weep with joy!
Take up the path of the archer with Heaven's Eye. Use the very elements as a weapon with Neither Sleet Nor Storm, and instill fear in foes as you Darken the Sky with Arrows!
Harness your ki energy with Iron Hand, manipulate the forces of pain and entropy with Sanguineous Rack, become a living juggernaut with Reaper's Field, and summon the spirits of the dead to join you in battle with Second Soul!




15 New Talents! 55 New Maneuvers! This is the perfect gift for the party Fighter for your 13th Age games! Even better, the book is watermark-free, so go on and share it with your gaming circle if your adventing party happens to contain a Fighter or two!

195760.name: Dungeon Intersection
195760.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 294th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a guarded four way intersection s it may be found in a dungeon.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 4032x4320 pixels in size at 144dpi.

195761.name: Broken Hill Class Prospector
195761.description:
From publisher blurb:

In 2285 AUship held a series of meetings with several large Australian resource companies operating large holdings both in Earth system and other interstellar locations. As the meetings progressed a specialized design began to evolve that would eventually become the Broken Hill-class prospector. Construction of a prototype commenced in July 2287 and by the middle of 2288, the five hundredth anniversary year of the settlement of Australia, orders were placed by all four participant companies. This entailed an order of sixteen ships with options for additional hulls should the design prove itself in service.

The prospector allows for up to four mining cutters to dock and transfer mined ore to the two ore holds. There are two cargo locks on either side of the access and docking spine that directly deliver ore to a hold via a dump chute. The prospector can only carry two mining cutters externally but the added flexibility of allowing two more cutters to simultaneously dock to transfer ore during mining operations is a definite bonus.

Ships of Clement Sector 12: Broken Hill-class Prospector comes complete with beautiful views of the ship. The prospector is presented with full deckplans and statistics to make your use of our product simple, easy and fun. In addition, the ship comes with a set of adventure hooks to get your characters right into the action as well as a short story written by Bradley Warnes.

In addition, Ships of Clement Sector 12: Broken Hill-class Prospector also includes the Venture-class Troop Transport. A variation of the Broken Hill-class prospector, the Venture-class troop transport is marketed as an affordable transport vessel for small system defense forces and private security contractors (mercenaries). The distributed hull design and large small craft carrying capacity of the Broken Hill allows for relatively inexpensive conversion into a light military transport.

195762.name: The Masks of Tzanti
195762.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the high valley walls of Kesh, darkness is growing. The followers of the Vile Spore God Tzanti have stolen the dreams of the Nubaran Seeress Deja, trapping them in an eldritch artifact. She is now blind to the future, and her kingdom trembles in fear at what is to come.

Those that wear the bronze masks of Tzanti sing now in praise to their lord, preparing a dark ritual that will bring forth the God's messenger from beyond. Unless her dreams are returned, the Seeress will descend into madness, and her people along with her.

In the land of Nubara, the people live and die by the prophecies of their chosen Seeress Deja, the holy servant of the Sun God. For many years, tensions had been growing between the Kingdom of Nubara and the Sand-Princes of Shen. The Seeress saw only blood and fire in a future of war, and worked hard to keep her King and her people on the path of peace and reason. Yet there were those who desired the chaos of war to visit Nubara.

These were not the Sand-Princes. It was the Cult of Tzanti, the Demon Prince of Fungus and Blight, who watched from afar and plotted Nubara's destruction. These men lived in the desert wastes of Kesh, the Land of Exiles. Long had they hated those that prospered in the Sun's light, and they saw an opportunity in the possibility of war.

The Masks of Tzanti is a setting-neutral Pathfinder adventure for 5th level heroes set in a primal, raw land. Come to the rescue of the Seeress and save Nubara from war! This Menagerie Press adventure includes six pre-made heroes so that players can leap straight into action.

195763.name: Bearing The Burden: What a Dog House
195763.description:
From the front page:

A Shadowrun 2nd Edition adventure for Virtual Seattle

You Rookies get to go to shadow school, while vets get to try their skills at a serious run. A little something for runners of all sorts.

User summary:

The adventure has two different plots, one for Newbie players and one for Veteran players.

195764.name: Onmyoji Archetypes
195764.description:
From publisher blurb:

Just as there are infinite kami, there are infinite ways to venerate them.

Class Expansions - Onmyoji Archetypes introduces two archetypes for Endzeitgeist top 10 of 2015 nominee The Onmyoji - A Japanese Occult Diviner, including one that, by popular demand, gets rid of the onmyoji's ever-present pet.

Grinning Fox - A many-tailed trickster who aligns himself with the kitsune, the grinning fox archetype does away with an onmyoji's shikigami, electing instead to obtain a larger spirit pool and a battery of sneaky spell-like abilities through excessive dipping into the Magical Tail feat.

Herald of the Lucky God - One of the onmyoji's more amusing features was Friendship feats, each aligned with one of the Seven Lucky Gods. The herald of the lucky god chooses one of the Seven, to the exclusion of the others, thus gaining abilities in line with his patron. From gaining influence over a tiny pocket of hammerspace to going berserk whenever your readied actions don't come to fruition, the Seven Lucky Gods have quirky abilities to fit most who would supplicate themselves before them.

195765.name: Yodel Bluff
195765.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your party has finally made it to Queen’s Point only to discover that the military was already aware of the approaching humanoid army and dealt with them. After a rest and training period in the large city you now have to decide what to do next. The large seaport has plenty of options but a curious problem has been brought to your attention. A large giant north and west of the city is harassing the shipping lanes with random boulder tossing. Word has it that a nice reward is available to anyone able to solve this problem. Did I mention a Medusa also has a proposition for the party?

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Provincia Campaign for a group of 4-6 adventurers that are level 4-6. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system.

195766.name: Macehuales
195766.description:
From the front page:
Macehuales
(Mexica: Part 2)

A One Round Virtual Seattle Tournament using Shadowrun II rules
By Cisco Lopez-Fresquet & Daniela Castillo

Someone needs a quick message sent, and you have been chosen as the deliverymen. But that is only the beginning of the story – are you willing to follow your employer into the heart of the enemy?

(Mexica is an alternate name for the Aztec people, it is usually pronounced Meh-shee-ca. It is what the word Mexico is derived from.)

195767.name: Tlacaelel
195767.description:
From the front page:
Tlacaelel
(Mexica: Part 1)

A One Round Virtual Seattle Tournament using Shadowrun II rules

By Cisco Lopez-Fresquet & Daniela Castillo

An anonymous employer needs some runners to keep a discreet eye on some out of town visitors, and you just happened to be available on short notice…..

(Mexica is an alternate name for the Aztec people, it is usually pronounced Meh-shee-ca. It is what the word Mexico is derived from.)

195768.name: Death Tractor
195768.description:
The luck of these average, run of the mill GMO corn farmers goes sour when their loyal tractors get fed up with the modifications the family is making to their corn. They transform into horrendous, murderous death machines hellbent on wiping out the Nomsantos and returning the crops to their pristine state.

However, the darkness has also changed the Nomsantos. You now mindlessly harvest a never ending crop while trying to destroy your competition, all while the Death Tractors hunt you down. How much corn will you harvest before your eventual death by tractor ends your pitiful life?

This totally serious, 100% accurate to life corn harvesting simulation experience will get your adrenaline pumping and nerves excited. You'll never be able to farm for corn in the same light again!

Source: The Game Website.

195769.description:
The Spirits are Restless …

Some deep conniving has led to a change in leadership for the Morgan Cattle Company.

Meanwhile, stars are aligning which are sure to shed light into some of the darker corners of Gomorra.

Doomtown: Reloaded is a fast‑paced expandable card game set in the Deadlands™ universe of gun slingin’, spell slingin’, and mud-slingin’!

With 40 new cards, Doomtown Pine Boxes are the premium expansion to give you new ways to customize your Doomtown decks. Whether your style is shootin’, spell castin’, or just trying to show that you have more money and influence than the next person, Ghost Town expands your options for takin’ over Gomorra!

IN STORES MARCH 28, 2016!

This product is an expansion, the base game is required to play.
195769.name: Doomtown: Reloaded – Ghost Town

195770.name: Swords & Galleons
195770.description:
User Summary
A pirate strategy game, where you are in control of you ship; you have to hire crew (gunner, cabin boy, etc), raid, and trade, and fullfil the goal of saving the Queen from Varisco.

You have to avoid accidents in order to keep your ship intact.

In some ways very similar to Sid Meier's Pirates

195771.description:
This one-tile expansion comes with two tiles: One for the traditional version of Carcassonne, one for the current version; designed by the respective artists Doris Matthäus and Anne Pätzke. It's found in the "Spiel doch!" magazine from the W. Nostheide Verlag.

The Labyrinth tile connects up to four separate streets and combines them to one street.
195771.name: Carcassonne: Das Labyrinth

195772.name: Otherworld Roleplaying Game
195772.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the Otherworld Roleplaying Game, you are an adventurer fighting to survive a world filled with magic, wars, monsters, and villains!

195773.name: For Mature Audiences
195773.description:
User summary:

In this game one player is the Tooth Dealer (game master) and the remaining players control Plushies (characters). The game requires that Plushies be physically represented by some type of plush object (e.g., a stuffed animal or similar). This may be commercially produced or, even better, home-made. During play, which occurs in phases, the object is mutilated and potentially destroyed.

195774.name: Panzermadels: Tank Dating Simulator
195774.description:
User Summary

Erwin Lemmor just got transferred to a prestigious military academy to study Armored Warfare. But when he arrives, Erwin realizes it's not Tank School, but "Tank School" for World War II Tanks.

195775.name: Drag Force Five
195775.description:
User summary:

On player assumes the role of Authority (game master) and the remainder create Divas (characters). Characters have four Stats (Attributes) - Drama, Resourcefulness, Anger, and Glamour. These have a numeric value assigned from a points pool. In addition, each character is physically represented by a paper doll, constructed during creation. Play involves the use of the representative object as well as dice pools of d10.

195776.name: Drag Force Five: Paper Dolls
195776.description:
User summary:

This accessory is provided as a ZIP archive containing eighteen image files (PNG). These images may be used as print-and-play components to create the paper doll character representations during character creation.

Note the images are quite rudimentary and suitable substitutes would be fairly easy to create or locate.

195777.name: Gin King / Cribbage King
195777.description:
Publisher's advertisement flyer
Talk about a Royal Flush! Now you can play Gin and Cribbage, two of the world's most popular card games, in one package. High resolution graphics; easy-to-use, menu driven features and the world's strongest card-playing algorithms make Gin King / Cribbage King the perfect profram for beginners as well as real card sharks. Plus, seven different computer personalities (each with his or her unique playing style) awaite you. Ask them for hinds and receive answers in conversational English!

PC World review line
One of the year's hottest releases.

Coder : Anne Westfall

195778.name: Promise Hollows
195778.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Promise Hollows - a wonderful example of a modern-day planned community, with rolling green hills and winding cul-de-sacs composing a graceful and prismatic suburban landscape.

The players take the roles of model Suburbanites of Promise Hollows. Each of them bring cheer to their neighbors, help to the needy, and a little something special to the town. And of course everyone is happy to serve in the number of Systems that help keep the town blissfully chugging along - grateful employers, a vibrant PTA, the City Improvement Committee, and more.

But behind this technicolor façade is a stark world of black and white and shadow. Each character is hiding a very fragile private persona, full of hurts, needs, wants, and some terrible guilt.

195779.name: City of Spies: Promo cards
195779.description: Promo cards with new characters to be use with the game City of Spies: Estoril 1942.

195780.name: Terribly Beautiful (Version 0.3)
195780.description:
From the introduction:

It is the dream of humanity to escape death. No one lives forever, but we hope that our lives mattered, that we will be remembered by the next generation. We have a lifetime to create that legacy. All too often most of that lifetime gets squandered. We come to realize the importance of our legacy only when it is almost too late.

They are the most desirable and seductive women in the city, the women of the night. Men are willing to travel into the most disreputable of neighbourhoods to meet them, offer money and gifts for but a few hours of their time or even less. They ply the oldest profession, selling their bodies into others’ fantasies.

But for the streetwalkers of the red-light district known as the Kaz, death takes its time. The disease known as the Pale stakes its claim by transforming its victims into visions of beauty, alabaster skin and elegantly thin. But beware, for death is a jealous lover, who lays claim to any who might make love to those already ill, and so they become known as the Terribly Beautiful. Shunned by society, they find each other and face the remaining days of their lives.

195781.name: Apple Trek
195781.description:
This is similar to the earlier mainframe-based Star Trek game. It runs in text mode and was written in Integer BASIC.

The object of the game is to defeat all the Klingons (called "Klarnons" in some versions) on the board. Resources may be replenished at starbases.

A depiction of the known quadrants is at the top of the text screen, with three-digit numbers indicating the number of Klingons, the number of starbases and the number of stars respectively. Navigating to a different quadrant reveals the adjacent quadrants. A depiction of the quadrant in which the Enterprise is present is in the lower left.

Absolute position is given as ordered pairs: vertical, from the top; and horizontal, from the left. Angle notation is navigation style: 0 degrees at the top, counting clockwise.

Two unusual features the game had, for text-based Star Trek games, were that when torpedoes were fired the player would see them travel, and also that the Klingons had torpedoes (in these early games, they were usually armed only with disruptors).

Source: Wikipedia, "Apple Trek", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

195782.name: Starwars
195782.description:
In 1978, Apple Computer produced an unlicensed Star Wars game on cassette tape for its Apple II. As a "space pilot trainee", the player destroys TIE fighters using a first-person heads-up display.

Source: Wikipedia, "Star Wars video games", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

195783.name: The Game of Divorce
195783.description:
Attention golddiggers! As you move your piece from start to finish on the board, you accumulate and discard husbands, always keeping track of your growing liquid cash assets (a tiny calculator and note paper is included in the box). Sometimes, you get to roll to steal other players' husbands. When possible, sink your liquid assets into real estate and businesses, in case a divorce goes wrong and you are the one who loses your shirt. Along the way, you land on "Up" or "Down" spaces which provide windfalls or disasters that affect your net worth. Once everyone has reached the finish space, everyone tallies up their total net worth and the one with the most money wins.

From game description: Up to 6 players. Each player begins with a zero balance in their bank accounts. Using the custom dice included in this game, each player takes turns moving their number of spaces around the board. The object is to become the richest by collecting Men, Homes & Businesses. Battle it out with your friends to see who will become the wealthiest. Travel around the game board trying your luck at earning great riches while dealing with the rewards and pitfalls of real life. Marry men, buy homes and collect businesses to end up the wealthiest player. The Game of Divorce is an absolute must to add to your board game collection. For entertainment purposes only.

195784.name: The Amulet of Shinkara
195784.description:
From the publishers blurb"

Before you spiral stairs, descend into a cobwebbed and vermin-filled grotto: the perilous lair of the orcs. The raiders of the Orc Lord Sharg have long menaced the local shires of Tenamen, but their thievery has now gone too far. Sharg’s Orcs recently stole the glowing green Amulet Of Shinkara whose unique healing properties alone can restore the ailing Lady Alana of Tenamen. You are oath bound to retrieve the amulet to save the princess. The 1,000 gold piece reward for the amulet’s retrieval certainly bolsters your willingness to descend into the skull-littered chambers below! Can you survive the unknown perils below and find the stolen amulet in time?

"The Amulet of Shinkara" is a 5th Edition fantasy adventure by Stan Shinn for 5e characters level 1-3 or 4-6.

This two-page, low-prep adventure is playable in 4 Hours but has adventure hooks to easily extend the adventure to 8 or more hours. A full-color map in included on the second page.

195785.name: Redmark Adventures Volume I: Varria (5E)
195785.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Welcome to adventures in the World of Redmark! This 40-page adventure module is indispensable for running sandbox-style 5th Edition fantasy games. It is a collection of 1-sheet adventures, gamemaster tools and campaign outlines to run high-energy roleplaying sessions with very little preparation. The Land of Varria provides a quick adventure setting which you can use, modify, or even replace with your own. The ten two-page adventures and three campaign arcs provide the opportunity for months of exciting adventures!

Also included is a 23 page Map Pack — all the maps in the module with both keyed versions for the GM and unkeyed versions for player handouts!

The GM Tools Include:

Regional Map
The Land of Varria Regional Map
Regional Overview
City of Nimroth Map and City Locations
3 Bullet Campaigns
20 Random Towns (each with an adventure hook!)
Random Encounters
Random Magic Items
Random Trinkets
Random Names
The Ten Adventures Are:

Eviction at Manor de Marce (Levels 5-7)
Savage Abduction (Levels 5-7)
Seize the Fey (Levels 5-7)
Johen’s Fatal Attraction (Levels 5-7)
Aftermarket Parts Part 1 (Levels 7-8)
Aftermarket Parts Part 2 (Levels 7-8)
The Return of Akhnabar Part 1 (Levels 8-10)
The Return of Akhnabar Part 2 (Levels 8-10)
The Return of Akhnabar Part 3 (Levels 8-10)
The Return of Akhnabar Part 4 (Levels 8-10)
And in the appendix is a rich list of:

Custom Monsters
Custom Magic Items

195786.name: Be A Better Campaign Master, Book One: Building the World
195786.description:
From publisher blurb:

The most streamlined worldbuilding sourcebook yet.

From the basic shape of your world, to the warring populations that inhabit it, you are the decider. You will pull the mountains out of the earth and make the raging rivers flow into the vast seas. You will scatter magical forests and arid deserts across the land, separating the cities and villages that you alone will build from the ground up.

127 pages of streamlined content to guide you through the worldbuilding process.
More than 1,000 options for unique geographical features, cities, dungeons, caverns, fortresses, and more to flesh out your world map.
Make your world map beautiful, using step-by-step drawing tips from Sellsword Maps.
Give your world a story, using a variety of interactive processes and tables.
Fill out your three-ring binder with 15 pages of useful worksheets.




You’ve been waiting too long to finish your homebrew RPG campaign setting. Now is the time to forge your realm for years to come.

Gather your imagination – there’s a world to be built!

195787.name: The Day the Kobolds Ruled the World
195787.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tasked with ending a conflict between neighboring Orcs and Dwarves, The party finds themselves stonewalled when a dozen Kobolds seemingly conquer the Dwarven city of Dun Boldar! Accompanied by a mysterious demon and an oddly pale little Girl, the Kobolds seem happy to rule over their new kingdom and its odd collection of Dwarf-shaped statues. With the lives of ten thousand Dwarves at stake, the Party must solve the mystery of the Kobolds and their mysterious guests, while fending off mad fairies, running odd errands, all while trying to stay on their feet as the city is rocked by earthquakes! Who is Staxx the Demon? Is Hena more than the cute girl she appears to be? And why does that statue look so much like the Dwarven Leader? Find the answers on “The Day the Kobolds ruled the world!”

195788.name: Tales of the Terrible Button Dragon
195788.description:
From publisher blurb:

When a series of grisly murders rocks the village of Markle on the eve of a momentous Gala, the Party finds themselves drafted into the roles of detectives! Charged with finding the culprit at all cost, their only suspect has a few holes in his Alibi… and his upholstery! Buttons the Dragon, former plaything of the Lady Markle and current town mascot has apparently gone rouge; and it’s up to the party to stop him! Despite the obvious clues, things just don’t add up. Could an enchanted stuffed animal really be the culprit? Exactly what is happening in the Tower of the old keep? And just why do all the witnesses keep acting so weird? With time running out, the Party must unravel the Tale of the Terrible Button Dragon, before it’s too late!

195789.name: Villainous Archetypes Volume V
195789.description:
From publisher blurb:

It’s Good to Be Bad!

Sick of saving the world? Tired of being expected to leap at the chance to solve everyone’s petty problems? Have a thing for twirling mustaches and overly-elaborate deathtraps? Why not mix things up with a villainous character! At some point in their gaming career, everyone has considered playing an “evil campaign,” but with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game being devoted to goody-two-shoes heroes, it can sometimes be hard to find support. Want some evil options for your character? You’ve found them!

This book presents five new villainous archetypes for five different classes. Included are the bloodboiler, a bloodrager archetypes whose rage is infectious, inciting allies and enemies both into a frenzied riot, the maligner, a druid archetype that specializes in turning animals and plants against civilization, and transforming them into more dangerous creatures, the zealous hound, an inquisitor archetype that denounces his foes to weaken them in combat, and specializes in dragging confessions from heretics and other sinners, the bokor, an occultist archetype that can exploit the connection between objects and their owners to enact powerful magic in the style of voodoo dolls, and the obsessive murderer, a stalker archetype that focuses on building a connection between himself and his prey to deliver truly devastating attacks.

Whether you're about to embark on a politically-themed campaign (such as Way of the Wicked, by Fire Mountain Games, or the first official Paizo adventure path made specifically for evil characters), or you just want an excuse to play an unrepentant, irredeemable villain, this book has lots of tantalizing options to offer. Even GMs can get in on the fun, as several of the archetypes here are perfect for villainous NPCs as well, and can make for exciting and memorable encounters.

195790.name: Prehistoric Ties
195790.description:
From the introduction:

In Prehistoric Ties, you and your friends tell a story about a prehistoric family living in a world populated by dinosaurs. The story you tell will detail the family's trials, adventures, and the things they learn along the way. You will need a pack of regular playing cards with the list of obstacles provided, this document, and two friends. It's also best to have some paper and writing utensils on hand.

195791.name: The Aleksander Dravo LARP
195791.description:
User summary:

This LARP typically is distributed as a ZIP archive containing numerous files:


Introduction - A Powerpoint overview of the LARP
Introduction - A MOV ("movie") overview of the LARP
Though - A Powerpoint exercise used to detect "thoughtcrime"
Thirteen Character Sheets - thirteen distinct characters developed and presented as Word document files
Special Character Sheet - a special replacement character sheet used during play
Six Image Files (5 JPG, 1 GIF) - handouts possibly used during play


The LARP presents an intriguing scenario that is highly original. Inter-character dispute resolution uses playing cards which are exchanged during play (preventing someone dealt "high" cards from dominating the action). The same process is used if combat occurs, though the cards are discarded instead of exchanged.

195792.name: Hell's Vengeance Player's Guide
195792.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Hell's Vengeance Player's Guide gives players all the spoiler-free information, inspiration, and new rules they'll need to create characters prepared for delving into the adventure and intrigue of the Hell's Vengeance Adventure Path, Paizo's first Adventure Path designed for evil player characters.

Within, players of this campaign will find everything they need to create character backgrounds tied to personalities and events vital to Pathfinder Adventure Path's themes of quelling dissent and upholding the infernal laws of Cheliax as villainous agents of the Thrice-Damned House of Thrune, along with new campaign-specific traits to give evil adventurers the edge they'll need to take on the dangerous threats faced in the Hell's Vengeance Adventure Path. This player's guide also features a brief overview of rhe nation of Cheliax where the campaign takes place, various class options and advice for nefarious villains, as well as six pregenerated evil characters ready to take on a Hell's Vengeance campaign.

There's an uprising in Cheliax to put down! Swear your loyalty to the Infernal Majestrix and let the Hell's Vengeance Player's Guide start you down the path to damnation and power.

195793.name: The Nautica System: Adventure in the Sky
195793.description:
User summary:

Characters in this rules-light game have four Core Abilities (Attributes): Drive, Agility, Brawn, and Mind. These have a Score ranging from 1-3, assigned from a points pool at creation. Characters also may select up to three Aspects (Traits) which are narrative tags or descriptions.

Difficult or opposed actions use a unique system for resolution. An eight-point "compass card" is used, and the game master selects a point (which varies with each use). The player then attempts to guess the point. The player may select one point for each Score in their relative Core Ability. Action difficulty yields a "spread" of points from which the guessed number may vary from the selected number and still yield success.

The setting is not well developed but in general has a action/adventure/swashbuckling feel to it. The setting would not be usable in a campaign without significant development.

195794.description:
From the publisher's website:

Noisy Person Cards is a party game designed to help you develop new character voices.

Using card matching mechanics inspired by games like Apples to Apples and Utter Nonsense, NPC challenges you to lend a voice to potential thousands of character combinations.

NPC is best when played with 3 or more people. Games can last from 10 minutes, to 2 hours, depending on how long you want to play. The print and play set is ok for folks aged 15+, and becomes ok for all ages when you remove the cards marked with a lil’ skull icon.

Players take turns speaking a selected phrase in the voice of a character chosen by the round's judge, who then decides who performed the best voice for the round. Both the judge and the speakers have ways to attach additional descriptors to the current character, Upping the Ante of difficulty, hilarity, and reward for the round.
195794.name: Noisy Person Cards

195795.name: Asterix i Spółka
195795.description:
Asterix i Spółka is a kind of memory game. You have 7 tiles of category. Above every tile You need to put one card (cover up) from fitting category. Shuffle cards leftover cards and create a deck.
Turn:
1) draw a card from deck and show them to players.
2) The first player who say which card was last played in this category take recently played card.
3) drawed card is covered and laying above category's tile.

Play long till deck is finished.
Winner is player with more recognized cards.

195796.name: Der kleine Hobbit
195796.description: A text adventure in german with theme based on The Hobbit by J.R.R. Tolkien.

195797.name: Ludwig Mystify
195797.description:
User Summary

A text adventure by Tobias Erbsland with a mystery theme.

195798.name: Bloons Monkey City
195798.description:
Create your very own Monkey City in the crazy world of Bloons Tower Defense. Take back the land from the mischievous bloon hordes and pop your way from a modest settlement to a thriving metropolis. Build more buildings and increase your arsenal of awesome monkeys, towers and upgrades. Explore the land in the world around your city, recover powerful magical items and attempt devilishly hard special missions. Engage in thrilling Monkey vs Monkey warfare by sending armies of bloons to attack your friends' cities to prove once and for all who has the best Monkey City.

Source: The Developer Website.

195799.name: Silantra: the game
195799.description:
Silantra: the game, is a 1-4 player cooperative trick taking card game inspired by the restaurant Silantra. In Silantra, you play as chefs in a kitchen serving customers their favorite entrees. As customers are fed, they reveal their special powers scoring you more points and abilities!
To feed customers, you and the other chefs take turns playing ingredient cards from your hand to match what your customers want to eat, which is displayed on the front of the card. After feeding the customers, you flip the card over and activate their special power and continue drawing more cards and feeding more customers! Good luck on your first wave of customers.

195800.name: Flucht im 20 Jahrhundert
195800.description:
User Summary

A text adventure there a man together with his Chinese friend have to go on a holiday to a strange country.

195802.name: Forest of Doom
195802.description:
User Summary

A text adventure by Darryl Mattlocks that take place in a fantasy forest.

195803.name: Gordon Saga
195803.description:
User Summary

A text adventure by Michael Nickles, where the player goes into a cave trying to solve puzzles and fight enemies.

195804.name: Totenstadt
195804.description:
Totenstadt is a tactical survival horror card game that takes the zombie apocalypse into a German city setting!

Totenstadt allows you take control of many different mercenaries like a firefighter, biker, priest, soldier, hitman, doctor, scientists and more — each with their own set of abilities — to defeat the gruesome hordes and fight for the survival of mankind! But beware because zombies are not the only problems you have to face in the dark streets as crazy people and even mutants will stand in your way!

On your way through the city, you will make some friends, too. Soldiers, adventurers, merchants and more will help you to fulfill your mission, grant you helping abilities, or give you equipment. It's all fun and games until you run into one of the events and all hell breaks loose! Are you ready to clean up the town and find out what really goes on behind the scenes?

195805.name: Hollywood
195805.description:
User Summary

A text adventure by Andreas Mettler with movies as theme. The game begins in New York, and the goal is to be settle in Hollywood.

195806.name: The Magic School Bus Explores the Ocean
195806.description:
User Summary

Based on The Magic School Bus on the Ocean Floor and The Magic School Bus Gets Eaten, this game features the Magic School bus crew taking a trip to the beach. You explore the various parts of the ocean on an educational treasure hunt.

195807.name: Duality: The Mirror Kingdoms
195807.description:
User summary:

This storytelling game represents characters by assigning them a few narrative Traits. Each character is comprised of a dual nature, much like the Mirror Kingdoms in which they live. The goal of the characters is to separate their dual natures completely (metaphorically, becoming two characters) prior to the end of the game. The game is played in phases with characters taking turns being the narrative focus.

Note - the game is presented as an ASCII text file with URL pointers to images.

195808.name: My Group of Role-Players
195808.description:
User summary:

The game features a meta-game structure: a game-within-the-game. Thus, characters in the game have Attributes, but in turn they also have characters that have Attributes. The first-level characters represent role-playing geeks playing a role-playing game among the second-level characters. The first-level game therefore takes place in a modern genre and setting whereas the second-level game takes place in whatever genre and setting the first-level characters select. Hilarity ensues.

Note both forms of the game - PDF and Text - present only textual content with references to artwork which is (rather, was) elsewhere.

195809.name: The Red Death (2007)
195809.description:
From the introduction:

[P]layers play dreamers smoking opium in a dim ornate room. They lay in the carpet or in black leather canapes. They smoke and talk. Talk about their dreams, until what they talk about, takes form in all their minds. From the cloud of smoke, arises a sealed palace. A castellated abbey enclosed by big ramparts and iron-barred doors...

User summary:

Characters in the game are no statistically defined, though they have several counter pools that represent various states. These states fluctuate frequently during play. While primarily narrative, the game does use a simple die roll to resolve opposed actions that cannot be resolved through narration.

195810.name: Aveyond 4: Shadow Of The Mist
195810.description:
The Story:

Boyle Wolfbane wanted to rule the world. He failed. Miserably. Forced into retirement early, Boyle now spends his days arguing with haunted trees and scaring off the occasional knight. At least he still has Fang, his loyal storm wolf. Things could be worse. He could have been born a hero.

A few notable features:

checkmark Recruit minions
checkmark Collect magical cheekis
checkmark Take part in a night watch
checkmark Join a coven
checkmark Transform friends into creatures
checkmark Discover mist portals

Source: The Developer Website.

195811.name: Midnight's Blessing
195811.description:
Sidni Larkhearst lived a simple life, delivering messages for her village, until her home is attacked by vampires one night. To her horror, Sidni learns that Dracula, the most feared vampire of all time is hunting her. But why? Find out in Midnight’s Blessing!

Source: The Developer Website.

195812.name: Threads of Destiny
195812.description:
A young girl has the ability to completely heal anyone with a simple touch. Follow Illya and her two brothers on a quest to understand the gift she’s been given.

Source: The Developer Website.

195813.name: Stargazer
195813.description:
When stargazer Zach watches the sky one night, he sees a star fall and land in the nearby woods. He rushes to check it out, only to find that out the star was actually a girl, and with her, magic returns to the world.

– Over 200 quests to find and complete for rewards
– Customize Aura’s magic abilities by finding meteors
– Seek out puzzle caves for additional rewards
– Three possible weddings between party members!
– Travel by boat, by underground train and by firewing

Source: The Publisher Website.

195814.name: Gunjitsu
195814.description:
User Summary

Using grappling hooks and weapons you swing and jump between buildings trying to kill enemies and gain powerups/armour. The look is fairly console retro with some inevitable comparison to Smash Bros.

195815.name: Higurashi When They Cry - Chapter 1: Onikakushi
195815.description:
User Summary

The music, backgrounds and characters work together to create a world that is the stage of a novel for the user to read.

195816.name: Higurashi When They Cry - Chapter 2: Watanagashi-hen
195816.description:
User Summary

The music, backgrounds and characters work together to create a world that is the stage of a novel for the user to read.

195817.name: Highschool Romance
195817.description:
User Summary

Can you find love as the only boy in an all-girls school?

195818.name: The Purring Quest
195818.description:
User Summary

Have you ever wanted to be a cat?

195819.name: Pokemon Super Mystery Dungeon
videogamehonor: 2016 D.I.C.E. Handheld Game of the Year Nominee
195819.description:
Players assume the role of one of 20 Pokémon (which include all 18 starting Pokémon from all six main series generations, along with Pikachu and Riolu), who are joined by partners who accompany them in their journey through procedurally-generated dungeons filled with enemies and traps as they help stop a major crisis and save the Pokémon world.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pok%C3%A9mon_Super_Mystery_Dungeon Pokémon Super Mystery Dungeon]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

195820.name: Lovely Weather We're Having
195820.description:
User Summary

Goal-free explorer that responds to your local weather.

195821.name: Moco Moco Friends
195821.description:
Moco Moco Friends is an exciting twist on the adventure RPG genre. Build your skills and amass loads of cuddly monsters to become the ultimate Plushkin Master! Battle against your rivals, scavenge items, venture through massive dungeons, evolve your Plushkin monsters, and travel with your companions across the magical realm of Dreamtopia!

Source: The Game Website.

195822.name: Monster High: New Ghoul in School
195822.description:
User Summary

Come roam the halls of Monster High and get to know your new classmates. Join clubs, make friends and dress up in fierce fashions.

195823.name: Nusakana
195823.description:
User Summary

You play as a tourist having a full-year vacation on the island, on a mysterious invitation.

195824.name: ROOT
195824.description:
User Summary

Whether creeping along corridors undetected or bursting into rooms to blow away all adversaries. Cyber terrorism is a dangerous profession.

195825.name: Mayan Death Robots
videogamehonor: 2014 Indie Prize Best in Show: Audience Choice Winner
195825.description:
Duke it out with massive alien robots during the peak of the Mayan civilization. Nuke, zap, implode, incinerate and destroy your friends. Win the adoration of your tiny Mayan tribesmen, and keep an eye out for Mayan Gods who will try to crash your party.

Source: The Game Website.

195826.name: Tactical Soccer The New Season
195826.description:
User Summary

Control all 11 players at the same time.

195827.name: Khan: Absolute Power
195827.description:
User Summary

Khan: Absolute power is an RPG MMO in which you gain control of Genghis Khan and his fierce troops. Important in this game is a unique party system to level up with. You need other players to level up.

It features: Guilds and Guild Wars, Hunting Parties, Siege Wars, Thousands of possible equipment combination, Item enchantment upgrades and many special event opportunities to win valuable awards and items for the player's continued quests

In this game you go to a small kingdom of Eurasia, which Genghis Khan was never able to conquer. Let's see if you can do better.

195828.name: LEGO Marvel's Avengers
videogameexpansion: Lego Marvel's Avengers - All-New, All-Different Doctor Strange Character & Level Pack
Lego Marvel's Avengers - Classic Black Panther Character & Level Pack
Lego Marvel's Avengers - Classic Captain Marvel Character & Level Pack
Lego Marvel's Avengers - Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. Character & Level Pack
Lego Marvel's Avengers - The Masters of Evil Character & Level Pack (Micro-DLC)
videogamehonor: 2015 Gamescom Best Nintendo Console Game of the Year Nominee
195828.description:
Avengers Assemble! The best-selling LEGO Marvel videogame franchise returns with a brand new action-packed, Super Hero adventure. LEGO Marvel’s Avengers features characters and storylines from the critically-acclaimed film Marvel’s The Avengers and the smash hit sequel Marvel’s Avengers: Age of Ultron, as well as playable content based on additional Marvel Studios blockbusters, including Marvel’s Captain America: The First Avenger, Iron Man 3, Thor: The Dark World and Captain America: The Winter Soldier. Play as Earth’s Mightiest Heroes in their quest to save the world.

Source: The Developer Website.

195829.name: Wind Child
195829.description:
Five souls, brought together in a simple rescue mission, to find and save one lone girl, find themselves pulled into something so much bigger than they had anticipated, so much larger than they know. Why are they opposed at every turn by an ancient sorceress? Why are they stalked by a vengeance-minded killer? How are the four greatest heroes in all of history connected? And is anyone who they say they are? Or who they believe they are?

As they explore a land founded by heroes and haunted by its tragic past, they will come to learn that they are more connected then they had believed.

Once they were strangers. Circumstances made them companions. The journey will make them friends. Destiny will make them heroes.

The first chapter of the Wind Child Saga begins now!

Source: The Publisher Website.

195830.name: Rising Angels: Hope
195830.description:
Rising Angels: Hope is the story of Faye Moonfallow, her squad of somewhat loveable misfits, and their dreams of joining the Katajion Space Force. However, before they can get there, they have to first pass the rigors of the Space Sector Academy. Life is rough, non-stop, and the danger of getting the boot is ever-present. Can Faye and her squad overcome the challenges posed to them or will the group destroy itself in chaos? Each day is an adventure as the young researcher tries to find her new place in the galaxy.

Source: The Developer Website.

195831.name: Cubicolor
195831.description:
Cubicolor is a minimalist puzzle game with soothing piano music.

The rules are simple: Match the color patches on the board and reach the exit, all on one single path. Every tile can only be touched once before it falls into nothingness. The game features 50 different levels and gets harder as you progress, always accompanying you with relaxing piano tunes.

Source: The Publisher Website.

195832.name: Bell Ringer
195832.description:
Bell Ringer is a fast paced arena PvP brawler with local and online multiplayer. Gather your friends and brace yourselves for some intense brawling! Choose between five unique characters with different weapons, special moves and styles.

Source: The Game Website.

195833.name: No Turning Back
195833.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

No Turning Back is a rogue-like Pixel Art Action-Adventure. The game is completely procedurally generated and the goal is to create a powerful Order from the 5 types of followers. There are currently 30 available classes to play as.

195834.name: Wave Mechanics
195834.description:
The goal of Wave Mechanics is to match the color of each element to the colors of corresponding parts of the frame. Each puzzle includes a set of active elements that can by used in order to change the colors of all elements within range in chosen direction, bear in mind however that the range of an active element decreases after each use.

There are 49 procedurally generated puzzles each time you start a new game.

Created by Adam Tarnowski.

Source: The Game Website.

195835.name: Piggy Princess
195835.description:
Help Piggy Princess escape from prison! As in angry bird games you launch Piggy Princess and get her out of one of the more then 50 levels (and they are still developing more. You use physics, water and objects to solve the puzzles. But in the end, the pig must be free!

Source: The Publisher Website.

195836.name: Death Pit Duels
195836.description:
In Death Pit Duels, you and your rival assemble a team of fantasy warriors who then duel in a series of one-on-one matches. Win the duel and take the spoils; lose and...well, it's not called a death pit for nothing! When the dust settles, who will be declared the victor?

The game is divided into two phases: Draft and Duel. In the Draft phase, players take turns splitting up randomly drawn fantasy fighter cards of various races (Cyclops, Goblin, Human, Orc) into two pairs. Their opponent then gets to select which pair to take. The player who originally split the cards into pairs must take the remaining pair of fighters that was unselected by their opponent. This continues until both players have built a team of twelve fighters.

The game then moves on to the Duel phase in which the players fight for a randomly drawn coin by revealing one of the fighter cards that they drafted. Each fighter has a base combat value and may also have a special ability to help them in the duel. The players simultaneously select a Duel card from their hand and reveal at the same time, adding the value of the Duel card to their fighter's combat value. The fighter with the highest adjusted combat value wins the coin. The game continues in this way until all twelve of a player's fighters have fought one duel each. The player with the highest total value in coins wins.

195837.name: 101 Ways to Die
195837.description:
101 Ways To Die is a physics-based puzzler with a twist.
It's not about Killing... It's about Killing with style!

As the assistant to the morally corrupt Professor Ernst Splattunfuder, you must help recreate '101 Ways To Die' - a book full of delightfully gory death recipes for dispatching your foes in the most stylish ways possible.

With an arsenal of deadly tools at your disposal, find the most violent and brutal ways to maim, slice, burn, explode, rip and impale the lab created creatures known as Splatts. Don't let them escape!

Source: The Game Website.

195838.name: Hustle Cat
195838.description:
You finally got a job in the big city. But your coworkers at this cat cafe disappear at weird times, and there’s something peculiar about your new boss, too...

A Cat Cafe With a Little Secret

You are Avery Grey, the newest employee at a popular cat cafe called A Cat’s Paw. The coffee’s good and the staff is friendly (and kinda cute!) but mysterious. One day, you find a strange book in the basement, with letters you can’t quite read...

Meet Your New Best Friends

You’ll work hard at A Cat’s Paw, but there’s still time to get to know your new coworkers! Who’s your favorite? The brusque, but devoted cook Mason? Or maybe Reese, the fashion-obsessed waiter who knows more than he says? And there’s always your strange-eyed boss, the enigmatic Graves.

Source: The Publisher Website.

195839.name: GuitarFreaks
195839.description:
GuitarFreaks is a music video game series produced by Konami. It is a rhythm game where the player uses a controller to simulate the playing of an electric guitar. The game consists of music predominantly from the rock music, rock and roll and J-pop genres. It is considered one of the most influential video games of all time, for having laid the foundations for popular guitar-based rhythm games, such as the Guitar Hero series. Working Designs attempted to bring Guitar Freaks PlayStation 2 games in the U.S., but patent problems with the guitar controller prevented the project from moving forward.

The game's nineteenth version, GuitarFreaks V8, was released in March 28, 2011. It was speculated to be the final release of GuitarFreaks V.
A spin-off series, GuitarFreaks XG was released in Japanese arcades on March 10, 2010, which added two more buttons to the fret bar.
A sequel, GuitarFreaks XG2, was released on March 9, 2011. Another sequel, GuitarFreaks XG3, was released on Feb. 23, 2012

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guitar_Freaks Guitar Freaks]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

The Japanese name is ギターフリークス

195840.name: One-Minute Little Bighorn
195840.description:
This year will mark the 140th anniversary of the Little Bighorn Campaign. This struggle has been depicted in numerous conflict simulation games; it is certainly one of the most fascinating subjects in the wargame hobby. One-Minute Little Bighorn is a microgame attempting to portray the battle with a small map and a limited number of counters.

One-Minute Little Bighorn is a solitaire challenge. The entire battle only takes about 60 seconds to play. However, the game offers a player most of the tactical choices available to Custer in 1876.

The player represents the commander of the 7th Cavalry and army units represent battalions containing several companies. Tribal warriors like Crazy Horse are included in the groups of Native American fighting men swarming out of the village to block the advance of the cavalry. Historical factors like the escape of tribal noncombatants, the arrival of Benteen, and rallying defeated cavalry formations are contained in the rules. Victory is determined by the level of success achieved by Custer... if he survives the battle.

This companion game to the previously released One-Minute Waterloo is a free Print & Play game with a single 8.5" x 11" map, charts, rules, and two dozen playing pieces or markers.

195841.name: Visual Star Trek
195841.description:
Definitely one of the best and most faithful Star Trek simulation game I've ever come across, Visual Star Trek is a perfect example that bigger doesn't necessarily mean better. Almost every system on the Enterprise is accurately modeled, down to the status reports. You can choose the universes ranging from tiny for a quick play to enormous for a real campaign, the enemy AI is competent, and there are always battles to fight and zones to explore in this dynamic simulation that few know about. Two thumbs up! (Home of the Underdogs)
Source: The Game Website.

195842.description:
"A party game for horrible Swiss people."

Play begins with a judge, known as the "Round Boss", choosing a red fill-in-the-blank card from the top of the deck and showing it to all players. Each player holds a hand of eight white answer cards at the beginning of each round, and passes a card (sometimes more) to the round boss, face-down, representing their answer to the question on the card. The round boss determines which answer card(s) are funniest in the context of the fill-in-the-blank card. The player who submitted the chosen card(s) is given the question card to represent a point, and then the player to the left of the Round Boss becomes the new Boss for the next round. Play continues until the players agree to stop, or until they are thrown out of the pub, at which point the player with the most Points is the winner.

Kampf gegen das Bünzlitum is a Swiss adaption of the popular Cards against Humanity. It features all new cards with Swiss celebrities, places and topics of interest.
195842.name: Kampf gegen das Bünzlitum

195843.name: Touché: The Adventures of the Fifth Musketeer
195843.description:
The game takes place in 1562 France. The protagonist is Geoffroi Le Brun who is recruited to a company of musketeers (the historical Musketeers of the Guard were not created until 1622) in Rouen. As he arrives, he witnesses the murder of the Compte d'Itee and promises to find his stolen will and deliver it to Paris. Early in his adventure he hires Henri, a crook who poses as a beggar, as his manservant. The pair travel through France including St. Quentin, Le Mans, Amiens and Le Havre.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Touch%C3%A9%3A_The_Adventures_of_the_Fifth_Musketeer Touché: The Adventures of the Fifth Musketeer]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

195844.name: Obsidian Apocalypse: Sinful & Vile Feats
195844.description:
From publisher blurb:

A dark star fell from the sky bringing with it the end of all things! The sanctity of the world known as Abaddon was shattered when a global apocalyptic event of a meteor impacting the planet causing a destructive ecological and eldritch change. Now there is no day or night, just never ending Apocalypse. An undead world ruled by fear and horror. Inside this book you will find you’ll need to add more interesting and unique feats to your exciting adventures in Obsidian Apocalypse.

195845.name: Terrors of Obsidian Apocalypse: Haunts
195845.description:
From publisher blurb:

On rare occasions a soul tainted by dread, fear, rage and anger leaves its broken corpse, if it is powerful enough, that soul may return as a ghost, a wraith or some worse form of undead. If it is powerful enough, angry enough…..Souls lacking the metaphysical hardiness to retain their own identity after death may also return to the living as something else, something lesser, a ghostly presence that blurs the line between a magical trap and a true undead. Inside this sourcebook you will find haunts you’ll need to enhance fear and terror in your home and local Obsidian Apocalypse including:

Creeping Ectoplasm (CR 2) - A minor haunt devoid of any shred of individuality or history,manifesting as a shapeless blob of ectoplasm.
Doors to Damnation (CR 9) - A soldier guarded this door against overwhelming forces and cursed the invaders with his dying breath when he finally fell.
Hangman’s Jig (CR 5) - A desperate prisoner was incompetently hanged in this small cell.An echo of his painful death lingers and haunts anyone visiting the room.
Memory of the Late Mistress (CR 7) - A woman died, choked to death by her jealous lover on this bed, forever tainting it with ghostly malice toward the living.
Warlock’s Doom (CR 8) - This haunt is the lingering residue of a powerful magician’s final stand—slivers of his spirit and the last spell he ever cast bound together in a volley of destruction unleashed against the world.
Plus nearly 15 more all new haunts.

195846.name: Obsidian Apocalypse: Player's Guide
195846.description:
From publisher blurb:

A dark star fell from the sky bringing with it the end of all things! The sanctity of the world known as Abaddon was shattered when a global apocalyptic event of a meteor impacting the planet causing a destructive ecological and eldritch change. Now there is no day or night, just never ending Apocalypse. An undead world ruled by fear and horror. Inevitably, in campaigns set in Abaddon, player characters will die. No matter which campaign model you use, it will overflow with mind-shattering horrors and lethal threats. Expand the already interesting and unusual races of the world of Abaddon. Inside this sourcebook you will find you’ll need to embark on adventures in the exciting setting of Obsidian Apocalypse:

All New Racial Archetypes for each of the Obsidian Apocalypse race ibcluding: Guardian Angel (cleric), Abaddon Pariah (ranger) , Harrowed Predator (barbarian) Hemotheurgical Leech (sorcerer) and Body Snatcher (rogue)
All New Greatwork: Mobius Body and Augmentations (Mobius Body)
And much more.

195847.name: World of Obsidian Apocalypse: Life After Undeath
195847.description:
From publisher blurb:

A dark star fell from the sky bringing with it the end of all things! The sanctity of the world known as Abaddon was shattered when a global apocalyptic event of a meteor impacting the planet causing a destructive ecological and eldritch change. Now there is no day or night, just never ending Apocalypse. An undead world ruled by fear and horror. Inevitably, in campaigns set in Abaddon, player characters will die. No matter which campaign model you use, it will overflow with mind-shattering horrors and lethal threats. Here, the world of the living is shared equally with the deceased, who linger in physical form before finally passing through the great beyond. Whether currently living or dead, residents and visitors are assured of an eternity of action and intrigue. Worlds of Obsidian Apocalypse: Life After Undeath expands the rules your options for when player characters die.

Inside this book you will find you’ll need to embark on adventures in the exciting setting of Life After Undeath:

Toolkit Setting Templates: Life After Undeath
Highly detailed regions and history, new organizations to launch your Life After Undeath campaign
Undead Character Options: Riven and Sundered (As races or character classes)
Over a dozen new feats and Magic Items




And much more.

195849.name: Splittermond Schnellstart-Regeln, Gratisrollenspieltag-Ausgabe 2016
195849.description:
User summary:

Quickstart rules, including an adventure module.

Printed for the Gratisrollenspieltag, the German equivalent of the Free RPG-Day.

195850.name: Mombasa: E1/E2 Company Track
195850.description:
This is a promotional item included with the wooden limited edition of Mombasa.

Company E1 allows investing players to interact with discarded card.

Company E2 allows investing players to permanently have diamond merchants and bonus mining icons for the company.

195851.name: Ein Spaziergang im Park
rpg: Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Roleplaying Game
195851.description:
User description:

A quickstart scenario for Iron Kingdoms.

Released on Gratisrollenspieltag 2016.

195852.name: Die Schatzkarte der Trollpiraten
195852.description:
User description:

A systemless scenario for 3-4 adventurous heroes.

With pirates.

And trolls.

Troll pirates, actually.

Can't go wrong with that!

195853.name: Cupid
195853.description:
Rosa's best friend, Catherine, is dead and she is sure Catherine's betrothed, Marquis Guilleme is to blame. Mother says so. Mother says he has to pay with his life. Although, she knows by now Guilleme is no ordinary man. He is tainted. A monster. He cannot be killed by usual means. To seek the best revenge, she must find out all his secrets and destroy him. But will her own dark desires consume her or liberate her?

No matter.

Mother will tell her what to do.

Source: The Developer Website.

195854.name: Medusa's Labyrinth
195854.description:
Medusa’s Labyrinth is a mythological first person horror game set in ancient Greece. It takes myths and legends that have stayed with us for over 2000 years and mix them together in a game that blends horror with stealth into a unique experience.

Source: The Publisher Website.

195855.name: Gefahr in Boston
195855.description:
User description:

People in Boston are going crazy! Even crazier than at a Sox game, apparently - in fact, the whole town has been sealed off! It's a Yanks fan's dream come true.

A Shadowrun supplement released at Gratisrollenspiltag 2016.

195856.description:
Bloodborne: The Card Game is based on the Chalice Dungeons in the video game Bloodborne — the ever-changing labyrinths and tombs carved out by the Great Ones beneath the fallen city of Yharnam, where horrifying creatures reside. Players compete to kill monsters and take their blood.

In general, Bloodborne is a game about risk management with a bit of group think, inventory management/upgrades, and tactical play. You start with a hand of basic weapons, which you get to upgrade to improve your fighting combos and capabilities.

Each turn, one monster chosen at random attacks players, who fight back as a team, with everyone playing a card from their hand simultaneously to attempt to kill the monster. Players collect blood from the monster, assuming it dies, based on how much damage they dealt. Monsters can fight back with exploding dice that can potentially deal infinite damage.

Players can fight as long as they want, but if they die in combat, they lose their progress. Players can opt out of fighting to bank their blood and save it permanently. Collected blood counts as victory points.

Says designer Eric M. Lang, "My goal with Bloodborne was to channel the intensity and frustration of the video game into a contest between players. Lots of death."
195856.name: Bloodborne: The Card Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: #24: The HYPE Episode! Gen Con 2016 Preview; Rocky Road a la Mode preview; Among the Stars on tap
#46: Ethnos six-pack review; Blood Rage on tap; CMON Expo round-up
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 015 – Top 10 Mechanisms
Episode 118: Mansions of Madness Second Edition, Arena of the Planeswalkers and The Impact of Artwork in Board Games
Episode 1: The one about us and our Gen Con recap
Episode 31: The Networks Review + Gencon 2016 Preview
Gen Con 2016 Day 0 Recap
Gen Con Day 2 Recap
RDTN Episode 92: Midnight Train to Georgia – CMON Expo, Eric Lang, Rodney Smith and Action Phase Games
Strange Assembly 213 - CMON Expo 2017
WIPNcast 126

195857.name: One More Dungeon
195857.description:
One More Dungeon is a first person shooter roguelike with procedurally generated levels and pixel-art graphics. Being a nameless adventure seeker, you have to get to the final level of the dungeon and destroy the obelisks, which is being used by forces of Evil to invade the world. Use a melee weapon, magic staffs, and antique artefacts, to burst way through the hordes of enemies inhabiting a few game areas.

Source: The Developer Website.

195859.name: FIVE: Guardians of David
195859.description:
Lead and play the five heroes, battling across exotic locations filled with archaic cultures, rich characters, and powerful artifacts. Experience one of the greatest stories ever told in this 11-Act epic.

Source: The Game Website.

195860.name: Strania: The Stella Machina
195860.description:
User Summary

A robot shoot em' up.

195861.name: Space Food Truck
195861.description:
Explore a vast, procedurally-generated galaxy in search of exotic ingredients, craft delicious recipes, and withstand the untold dangers of deep space.

Space Food Truck is a cooperative deck building game, so each character starts with their own deck of cards and a unique job to do. Everyone will have to pull their weight if you want to win! You’ll add new items, ingredients, and special abilities to your character’s card deck every turn. Choosing new cards wisely is crucial to surviving the escalating hazards of deep space.

You start by picking one of four unique jobs on the food truck: Captain, Chef, Scientist, or Engineer. If you have less than 4 players, you’ll get to control more of the crew (or all of it if you choose to play alone).

Together, your team will hunt down and cook exotic ingredients to craft delicious recipes, then scramble to the planets craving each dish to complete your objectives. Finish every recipe before your ship falls apart to win.

Source: The Game Website.

195862.name: Umihara Kawase Shun
195862.description:
The move to a 3D game world was not universally welcomed, however, as it decreases the ease with which the player can identify the exact point in space where platforms begin and end.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Umihara_Kawase%23Umihara_Kawase_Shun Umihara Kawase]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

195863.name: Heroes Never Lose: Professor Puzzler's Perplexing Ploy
195863.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

A superhero themed puzzle game.

195864.name: RC Simulation 2.0
195864.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Drive all kinds of RC Cars, Boats or Quad Copters on any of the RCSim 2.0 Workshop Tracks. RCSIM includes an in-game Track editor to create an infinite amount of scenarios.

Source: The Game Website.

195865.name: Valhalla Hills
videogameexpansion: Valhalla Hills - Sand of the Damned
195865.description:
Lead your people. Survive the wilderness. Fight for honor. Reclaim your eternal reward. A brand new strategy game from the developers of Cultures and The Settlers II.

Source: The Game Website.

195866.name: Corgi Warlock
195866.description:
User Summary

One brave Corgi will take on the Skeleton Bunny King's army!

195867.description:
Description from the publisher:

Papà Paolo brings you to the beautiful city of Naples, birthplace of one of the world's favorite dishes: pizza.

In Papà Paolo, 2 to 4 players compete to deliver the most pizzas to the hungry customers of Naples. To do this, you must outsmart your rivals by being a clever investor, bidding on the right city tiles, and creating your own little district of Naples.

Over the course of five game rounds, players first have to plan their actions carefully, choosing whether they want to invest in new pizzerias, make express deliveries, get sponsored by the bank, or decide to expand their district. Once all players have used up their action tokens, players get rewarded by receiving Lira, which they can then use in a bidding phase to determine how many deliveries you can make, and how many pizzas you can deliver.
