Once you deliver pizzas to your hungry customers, they reward you by boosting your abilities, making each action more powerful as the game progresses. Every decision counts, but Papà Paolo is a very accessible game, which will charm players of all ages alike.
195867.name: Papà Paolo
boardgamepodcastepisode: HLG 9: Essen in Zicht
HLG-EXTRA 3: Spiel 2016 Deel 1
HLG-EXTRA 4: Spiel 2016 Deel 2
The Game Pit: Episode 78 - Battle Report from LobsterCon XII
Vox Republica 129: Extra Life Extravaganza

195868.name: Dying Light: The Following
videogamehonor: 2016 Global Game Awards Best Co-op Game of the Year Winner
2016 Global Game Awards Best Expansion of the Year Nominee
195868.description:
Dying Light: The Following is an expansion pack. The expansion introduces new characters, a new story campaign, new weapons and gameplay mechanics.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dying_Light%3A_The_Following Dying Light: The Following]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

195869.description: C'est mon Fort! is a fun family card game based on memory and strategy. It consists of a deck of numbered cards representing wall parts. Each player must build a wall of cards in ascending order. All the cards are laid face-down on the center of the table. Each player starts a wall with the card numbered 1. On each turn the player chooses a card from the center, reveals it to everyone, and then decides to either keep it and put it on the right end of the wall or put it back face-down. The end of the game is triggered when a player puts a 10th card. The player with the wall with the most points wins the game.
195869.name: C'est mon Fort!
boardgamepodcastepisode: Podcast EP12 – Événements ludiques

195870.name: Casus Belli (Issue 74 - Mar 1993)
195870.description:
(translated) from the cover


Paorn. Discover our new medieval fantasy universe
New. Stella Inquisitorus
Medicine in the twenties
The French in ASL. Croix de guerre
'92 Trophies results

195871.name: Bux!
195871.description:
Each player has 16 playing pieces: 7 hunters, 4 catchers, 2 scouts, 2 squires and 1 bux-master. The goal of the game is to capture the opponent bux-master. The hunters move up to 2 spaces, the catchers up to 3 spaces, the scout up to 4 spaces, the bux-master and his squires 1 space (no jumping over other pieces allowed). If pieces of both payers are on three connected spaces in a straight line, the minority piece is eliminated from play unless it is able to escape in the next turn.

There are rules for 2 variants included:

Buxelkuh: One cow has to break through a line of 9 peasants and 1 mayor. The latter try to trap the cow.

Buxtehu: The players try to get all 16 playing pieces to the opposite end of the game board. Each time a player gets one of his pieces to a space at the other end of the board, he may take one or more enemy pieces off the board. The game ends if all 11 spaces at one end of the board are occupied or if there ar no more pieces on the board. The player with the most captured pieces wins the game.

195872.name: Casus Belli (Issue 63 - May 1991)
195872.description:
(translated) from the cover


Akira. Welcome to Neo-Tokyo
Trial by fire. Heavy Metal
Dossier. Russian Front
Zargos: tactical advice

195873.name: Casus Belli (Special Issue 12 - Jul 1994)
rpgissuearticle: Chef à la Place du Chef
Les détectives de la Guerre des Etoiles
Mais où est donc passé cette machine?
Travelling sur l'Egypte et Le Caire dans les années vingt
Un jeu dans le jeu: la cryptographie
195873.description:
User summary:

A collection of nine scenarios and five player aids - including a solo adventure - for a variety of different games.

195874.name: Block 2 Block
195874.description:
Block 2 Block was designed with players and customization in mind. There are many variant rule sets which make the game a new yet familiar experience. We invite you to come join the community of players and enjoy.

Players roll dice to determine how many blocks they can place on tiles at various tiers. As the tiles are revealed and claimed, new tiers worth more points open up and players can start revealing and claiming tiles there. Different tiles have different powers, some let you remove blocks from other tiles, some remove tiles completely, and some move or switch tiles in different tiers.

The ultimate goal is to accrue the most points, through skillful use of tile powers, wise investments, and some luck with the die.

195876.name: Monstro: Battle Tactics
195876.description:
Monstro takes the traditional tRPG gameplay and reconstructs it into a completely deterministic, logical experience with a twist of tactics. All of this is spiced up with ridiculous, tongue-in-cheek lore and approachable difficulty.

Source: The Game Website.

195877.name: Sphere III: Enchanted World
195877.description:
Take a journey to an epic fantasy world of Sphere 3: Enchanted World, the PvP-based MMORPG with hardcore non-target system! Play it for free to experience massive battles, breathtaking castle sages, deep storyline and even more.

Source: The Game Website.

195878.name: Sid Meier's Civilization Revolution 2
195878.description:
The sequel to one of the most successful strategy games on mobile is here! Sid Meier's Civilization Revolution 2 challenges players to build a glorious empire that will stand the test of time. This is the first game in the Civilization catalog to be developed and available exclusively for mobile devices. Civilization Revolution 2 offers mobile strategy fans a brand new 3D presentation and more tactical depth than ever before! Find out if you have what it takes to rule the world!

Source: The Developer Website.

195879.name: Excalibur (Issue 4 - Jun 1992)
rpg: In Nomine Satanis / Magna Veritas (1st Edition)
195879.description:
User summary:

Issue theme: Gods, Demons and Wonders

195880.name: Barbarian
195880.description:
From the introduction:

Not all barbaric warriors are hulking slumbering savage brutes; some are quick agile savage brutes. The path of the Furious Dervish is for those quick warriors that prefer to become a flurry of attacks and rage despite their size, much like a cornered animal.
...
Some warriors prefer to fight up close an personal. While most adventurers engage in fist fighting from time to time and have heard of exotic warriors from distant monasteries few dare to oppose those who take glee at snapping necks. The Mauler's path is dirty and bloody, and they wouldn't have it any other way.
...
Some barbarian warriors are more than just fighters, combining their martial prowess with a shamanistic tradition. This mystic understands the ways of the spirits and acts as a bridge between them and his warrior brothers.

195881.name: Bard
195881.description:
From the introduction:

Bards from the College of Adventure are explorers and heroes, equally apt to dive headfirst into court, city or dungeon adventure.
...
Bards from the College of Dance are exotic and wild. Their moves have long dazzled allies and enemies everywhere, the former by their grace and beauty, the later by the quickness of their blades.
...
Bards from the College of Espionage are minstrels who act as assassins, spies or saboteurs. Found in the courts, where intrigue is as common as silk, the successful ones remain keep hiding their true profession.

195882.name: Cleric
195882.description:
From the introduction:

The Charm domain focuses on beauty, love and passion. Charm Gods are sensual and inspiring, but also dangerously fickle.
...
The Creation domain concerns itself with the crafts of man, from metalsmithing to city-building. Gods of city, civilization and specific crafts may have this domain.
...
The Retribution domain concern justice be it by the laws of man or by the force of your own arms. Gods of law, oaths, passion and vengeance may have this domain in their portfolio.

195883.name: Druid
195883.description:
From the introduction:

The circle or rebirth is made by druids who celebrate the natural circle of life and death. Many see them only as healers, but the few who truly care about their ways understand that death is as much part of life as life itself.
...
Druids from the Circle of Seasons celebrate the eternal dance of elements, and bring their chosen season's might to bear upon the enemies of nature with elemental fury.
...
People who dance under the moon. That curse the unwary. These are a few of the things that followers of the Circle of Witchcraft are known for. These wielders of the "dark arts" spawn these legends, and more.

195884.name: Operation: Burning Presidents (White Lies)
195884.description:
From publisher blurb:

BEGIN MESSAGE.

OPERATIVE JOHN DIXON (CODENAME FOXTROT) HAS GONE MISSING. HE WAS ENGAGED ON A CRUCIAL MISSION TRACKING DOWN CONNECTIONS BETWEEN AN ORGANIZED CRIME FAMILY AND A TERRORIST ORGANIZATION ACTIVE ON U.S. SOIL KNOWN AS THE FREEDOM BRIGADE. YOU ARE TASKED WITH FINDING AND RECOVERING AGENT FOXTROT, AND CONTINUE HIS INVESTIGATION INTO THE FREEDOM BRIGADE.

END MESSAGE.

This is a mission for the White Lies roleplaying game. It was first published for the Covert Ops game system and has been re-imagined for White Lies. Players will use their skills and instincts to find and recover the missing operative. While they do this, they will uncover a plot that only they are in a position to thwart. If they are successful, Agent Foxtrot will be saved and the world will be made more secure. If they fail, they will watch helpless as presidents burn...

195885.name: Fighter
195885.description:
From the introduction:

Who dares, wins, that's the Daredevil's motto. These chaotic warriors thrown caution and orthodox tactics to the wind and somehow still manage to come on top. Usually.
...
The Guardian focus on the defensive aspects of their martial training, to protect and aid his brothers in arms. To him taking down his foes holds little meaning if he is the only survivor.
...
The clash of steel and the sizzle of spell energy are drowned out by the thunderous rhythm of gunfire — the pounding beat of the gunslinger. These bold warriors bring the modern warfare to the same old battlefields.

195886.name: Dragon Radieux (Issue 22 - Nov 1989)
195886.description:
User summary:

Special detective novels issue.

Scenarios for Stormbringer, Rêve de Dragon and Call of Cthulhu.

195887.name: Battlerooms 1
195887.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explorer: Battlerooms is a set of printable battlemaps compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game.

Explorer: Battlerooms 1 is a standalone set, comprising 8 10x12 battlemaps. Each tile depicts a different and unique room, idea for quick encounters when your party is exploring a dungeon, fighting an encounter or in the showdown with a boss!.

Dwarven Hall: A hall in warm yellow stone, carved with Dwarven symbols.
Evil Altar: A room dominated by a large carved skull, and evidence of arcane practice
Ice Magic: A cool chamber with ice and magic symbols.
Ruined Ballroom: Cracked and ruined flooring of a grand building
Temple of the Three: A small temple with three statues watching over.
The Circle Hall: A large and open room with inlaid circular patterns
Spider Den: An ancient abandoned room, full of cobwebs
Pool Room: A small chamber with a shallow pool

195888.name: Evening Session Map Set #12
195888.description:
From publisher blurb:

Do you need an encounter map on the fly?

Have Your players turned left instead right (again!)?

Do You want to run a quick game for your friends in the evening and looking for inspiration?

If you answered yes for one (or more) of these questions, The Forge Studios has released a product that suits your needs.

Evening Session Map provides an excellent starting point for GM to make an interesting encounter or one shot adventure for one evening play. Each product in the line consists of notebook for a GM and handouts, which can be printed and presented to players.

'Evening Session Map #12' consists of maps and handouts of an old prison located on a remote island.

The set consists of:

an island map ;
a perspective drawing of a prison ;
three levels of a prison

195889.name: Adventure Awaits!
195889.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deep diving into adventure hooks!

Adventure hooks can intrigue and inspire, and no two GMs will come up with the same adventure from a single hook. Adventure Awaits! deeply examines adventure hooks and the process of creating adventures from there. What questions should you ask when developing storylines, encounters, and rewards?

Additionally, Adventure Awaits! provides many additional hooks for you to develop and use on your own, as well as tables of XP Thresholds for each character level you can use when budgeting encounters.

195890.name: Dungeons on Demand: Volume Three
195890.description:
From publisher blurb:

THE THIRD SET OF DUNGEONS ON DEMAND ADVENTURES!

The third volume of Dungeons on Demand includes the these four dungeon adventures:

An Axe to Grind - Level 3 Adventure Dungeon
If Looks Could Kill - Level 6 Adventure Dungeon
Eyes on the Prize - Level 10 Adventure Dungeon
Best Served Cold - Level 14 Adventure Dungeon




It also includes the following supplements:

Weapons of Legacy - Gaming Supplement
Adventure Awaits! - Gaming Supplement




The bundle includes hundreds of pages worth of materials and supplements sure to keep your gaming sessions busy!

195891.name: If Looks Could Kill
195891.description:
From publisher blurb:

For a level 6 party!

Everyone in the villages that once made up the Kingdom of Lilies knows the tragic tale of Queen Niva Brysis, a fair and beautiful sovereign from a past generation. The queen and her kingdom are often thought of in the same regard; the kingdom didn’t truly come into being until her birth, blossomed in her youth, and wilted away as the queen aged and succumbed to madness. Of course, this is in the annals of history now, as Queen Niva died decades ago, crazed and alone in her mountain keep… right?

Not according to a new cult calling itself The Queen’s Adherents. This group not only claims that Queen Niva is alive and well, but she has regained her youth and former beauty. What’s more, they promise any that join their ranks may receive their queen’s blessing and become immortal themselves! The PCs are ultimately the ones that need to dissolve the cult from growing, and in doing so look into the mystery behind the queen’s enigmatic return. But be careful, because if looks could kill, this mission could be murder!

195892.name: Eyes on the Prize
195892.description:
From publisher blurb:

For a level 10 party!

For ages, “the old monastery on the hill” was simply that and nothing more to those that knew of it – a small building of a forgotten age and purpose, overgrown by the land around it. But recently, rumors have been making way among the educated that there is a wealth of knowledge that hides within the old monastery, waiting for someone to find it. Most dismissed these rumors as hearsay... but those with their eyes on the prize continued to pay attention.

There must have been some merit to these claims, because seemingly overnight a monstrous creature has appeared on the monastery grounds - a serpent the size of a dragon, with a dozen legs and breath that crackles with lightning! There's no doubt the rumors and the monster's appearance are related somehow, and the PCs are tasked to put their skills to work to figure it out!

195893.name: Best Served Cold
195893.description:
From publisher blurb:

For a level 14 party!

The White Reach is a frozen wasteland far removed from the bastions of civilization. It's in this cold abyss the world's ley lines of magical power converge, blurring the lines between realms and causing spells to be unpredictable. It's generally avoided for it's unforgiving environment, but with magic suddenly and rapidly fading from the world, it's the last place magic users find their spells still work!

Whatever has caused the recent magic drain seems to have originated from this place, but scholars can only speculate. Without magic to aid them, no one really knows what's happened to cause the crisis. They've turn to the PCs to investigate - sending them to the frigid depths of the White Reach on a mission best served cold of monstrous proportions!

195894.name: Weapons of Legacy
195894.description:
From publisher blurb:

Weapons that grow in power with their wielders!

Inside are 9 new magic weapons to use in your 5th edition campaign. Each weapon is presented with a rich back story and personality - these items are living legacies of great heroes or tragic events! Dynamic and increasingly difficult methods are required to unlock their later powers, leading to some interesting role-playing or combat challenges.

195895.name: A Random Encounter (Issue 1 -  Feb 2016)
195895.description:
From the publisher:

Issue 1 of A Random Encounter focuses on David McGrogan, aka noisms, whose blog Monsters and Manuals was the starting point for one of 2015's indie RPG success stories, Yoon-Suin. We talk about how Dave got into games, the origins of Yoon-Suin, his creative process and a lot more.

195897.description: Second expansion for the game Caçadores da Galáxia (Galaxy Hunters). Includes 3 new pilots, 3 new robots, components to add a 5th player (or 6th if using Froteiras Expansion) and add 2 new modules to the game: New Planets Colonizing and Robots Upgrades and Initial exclusive powers
195897.name: Caçadores da Galáxia: Colonizadores

195898.name: Casus Belli (v2, Issue 1 - Apr/May 2000)
195898.description:
(translated) from the cover:


Dungeon in the cinema
Glorantha dossier
The Belgariad universe
Acheron's Call
Everquest


Includes Casus Master issue 1 (scenario booklet).

195899.name: The Warden
195899.description:
User Summary

In 'the Warden' you are Elias Barkley, a landowner who also has a bit of an alcohol problem. After losing his family he tends to have moments of lucidity but also trances which leave mysterious drawings of landscapes with a big figure with deers horns.

It's up to you to solve this mystery.

195900.name: Hiragana Pixel Party
195900.description:
A rhythm-action platforming Japanese-learning chiptune adventure!

By combining several different learning methods and a heap of fun, Hiragana Pixel Party is quite possibly the most fun way to
learn the Japanese alphabet around. Even if you aren’t interested in learning Japanese at all, the game stands on it’s own as an
exciting and engaging experience.

Source: The Game Website.

195901.name: Bloons Super Monkey
195901.description:
Take control of Super Monkey as he embarks on a Bloon popping frenzy through 5 stages and 15 waves. Collect and use Power Blops to upgrade Super Monkey in three different skill paths. Watch out for super powerups and make sure you score at least Bronze in each wave to advance to the next. Good luck!

Source: The Developer Website.

195902.name: Infantry Assault: 1944 the Western Front
195902.description:
First volume of Infantry Assault

Infantry Assault is a skirmish game between 2-4 players on various fields of battle. The objectives are varied and include a campaign which can be separated into several scenarios if you wish.

The major asset of Infantry Assault is to provide a fluid game system with ease of access, to share the fun of miniature games with family and friends, and for people outside of the hobby to discover the pleasure of the game. The simplicity of the game is thanks to a unique and ingenious system, this will keep the tactical advantage of this type of game, implementing a storyline. In campaign mode, the winner will be the player who gains the more points at the end but there is no obligation to play each scenario in an orderly manner.

195903.name: 2184 Generation War
195903.description:
After numerous wars and conflicts in which history has forgotten their names, the planet Earth has become a vast territory where only irradiated animals and humans fighting for their survival live in this devastated world, cities comprise of the last humans unaltered by toxic winds that now sweep the surface. Directed with an iron hand by draconian dictatorships, they are the theater of war between the various institutions in place. These wars give grounds for many skirmishes despite an omnipresent police force overwhelmed by the violence of this closed universe.

2184 is a skirmish game between 2-4 players on various fields of battle. The objectives are varied and include a campaign which can be separated into several scenarios if you wish. You will choose a clan among the 6 available and will evolve its leaders over 3 generations. When your leader has gained 10 points of experience, his son will succeed him then the son of his son, the third generation will be able to access a new field of competence : PSY powers.

The major asset of 2184 is to provide a fluid game system with ease of access, to share the fun of miniature games with family and friends, and for people outside of the hobby to discover the pleasure of the game. The simplicity of the game is thanks to a unique and ingenious system, this will keep the tactical advantage of this type of game, implementing a storyline and tracking the progress of your clan leader who will become stronger over sessions. In campaign mode, the first player to reach level 10 with his 3rd generation wins the game. There is no obligation to play each scenario in an orderly manner. The life of this game is like an open book with many possibilities.

2184 Generation War is a rulebook. No miniatures brand imposed.

195904.name: Platoon Command
195904.description: In Platoon Command you take the role of a platoon leader, guiding your platoon into combat in order to capture critical battlefield objectives. Platoon Command is a quick-playing game that uses cards for combat, command and control, fog of war, and attrition. The mission objective is to gain Objective Points by controlling areas of the battlefield. You accomplish this objective by issuing orders to your command group, three rifle squads, and specialized personnel.

195906.name: Bloons Super Monkey 2
195906.description:
Super Monkey rockets out on a brand new mind-bendingly over the top scrolling shooter! Suit up a Super Monkey of your own invention by outfitting his three weapon slots with 60 amazing upgrades, and then fly like mad to give the bloons what they deserve - a volley of darts, boomerangs, bombs, magic, and tech right in the knots. Super simple controls mean anyone can play, but it'll take skill and smarts to win the prestigious bronze, silver, and gold trophies by defeating enough of the outlandish bloon formations and the powerful bosses. Top-tier epic powers, weapon-juicing research, powerups, and Ultimate Monkeys that channel destruction incarnate are all yours to discover and unleash. Challenge yourself to earn all 18 achievements and heaps of Awesome that go with them, including the incredibly tricky Diamond Trophy achievements. Now get out there and pop bloons for the good of all monkeydom - go, Super Monkey, go!

Source: The Developer Website.

195907.name: Guardian II: Revenge of the Mutants
195907.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Stargate.




From the inlay:

The original 'Guardian' game was described as 'an amazing and fast moving space spectacular in the classic mould'. It was also considered by many in the home computer games industry as a standard by which others were judged.

Now Hi-Tec Software brings you the sequel, 'Guardian II', where the mutants really do get their revenge in this even faster and more amazing game that tests your skills to the limit.

Arcade and high score freaks, no need to queue here, just ooad up and hang on in there.

User Summary

Guardian II is based on the arcade classic 'Stargate' (Defender II).

195908.name: Valiant: Resurrection
195908.description:
Travel to the cloud land of Asteria, home of the mighty titans, and all types of magical creatures. It’s here where Argo and his dragon Golagros must go to restore the life of a fallen princess. With the help of the inhabitants, you must face the Fallen Titans and avoid the Judges, a shadow race, who watch over all of Asteria.

Explore the lands of Sirenus Bay, God’s Garden, Whitebleak, Fort Ember, God Snare, and the mysterious Immortal’s Abyss. Are you brave enough for this adventure?

Source: The Developer Website.

195909.name: Edolie
195909.description:
All across the world of Edolie, people are gathering to celebrate the coming of Harvest, the biggest event of the year. Feasts and dancing will mark the passing of another generous year.

For Willow it’s a chance for her to travel to a neighborhood island to watch the festivals unfold, but this is going to be a harvest unlike any that have come before.

Troubles from this magical world’s dark past and conspiring events are about to be unleashed. A discovery is made far away that will bring everyone into danger, so why does nobody care?

Discover the secrets of Edolie as you adventure with a group of new found friends, seemingly alone in their desire to discover what is going on.

Source: The Publisher Website.

195910.name: Guardians of Artural
195910.description:
Dungeon crawler with large amounts of MMO influences. Characters will have multiple specializations. There will be quests to complete, dungeons to explore, as well as large raids you can complete. All while playing solo or with your friends and family.

You use actions, to move your character around a map, while using dice, and playing cards to kill the enemy's. Receive loot cards to increase your characters abilities and gear to progress through the campaign.

195911.name: Epic Quest of the 4 Crystals
195911.description:
In a world where classic tales come together, a young man must go on an adventure to collect four elemental crystals and save the earth!

Theodore lives a peaceful life, until one day General Kujae of the Empire comes to the village to capture him. He escapes and encounters a mysterious woman, who sets him on a grand adventure to collect four crystals and save the world from the evil Emperor!

Epic Quest is an intelligent parody and an amazing journey through a world where classic RPGs come together. Meet Rhen from Aveyond, Wendala from Laxius Force, Bubbles from Whisper of a Rose and more! A mind-blowing story and unique cast bring these beautiful tales together in one epic adventure!

Source: The Publisher Website.

195912.name: A Sea Deep, Cursed and Rotting
rpg: A Sea Deep, Cursed and Rotting
195912.description:
User summary:

Characters primarily are defined by narrative Traits though they do have one Attribute - Luck - defined by a random roll. Action resolution involves a 2d6 roll where the lowest die indicates speed and the highest die indicates power. Actions happen in speed order and have effect according to the power. Circumstances or equipment may modify the power roll.

Characters begin the game by being "captured by the Flying Dutchman" and subsequently struggle with "becoming damned".

195913.name: Honour by Day... (Original Version)
195913.description:
A Game of Honour and Deceit

From the introduction:

In a game of Honour by Day the players will assume the role of 14th century knights competing at a Tournament, set in an unspecified European country. The players will guide their knights, competing to achieve victory both on and off the field of battle.

User summary:

Includes these concise scenarios:


The Tournament of St. George
The Battle of Stirling Bridge

195914.name: Honour by Day: Play Sheets
195914.description:
User summary:

Several play sheets are available to assist in playing the game, especially the two scenarios presented in the core rules. These sheets usually are distributed as two separate PDF files, one containing a two-page print-and-play character sheet and the other including these print-and-play components:


One-page character sheet
Tournament sheet
Tournament Rules summary
Battle Sheet
Battle Rules summary

195915.name: The Adventures of Blake Borrow, World-Class Archaeologist
rpg: The Adventures of Blake Borrow, World-Class Archaeologist
195915.description:
User summary:

All characters in this amusing game are frauds. They take turns being the narrative focus while the other players act as "board members" at a common archaeology society. On each turn, a character draws (yes, literally draws) some cave drawings and then claims to have discovered them and claims they are true antiquities. Throughout the game characters attempt to win "Back Pats" (e.g., pats on the back) which count as points toward winning.

From the game:

[T]he game is all about forcing the other players to pat you on the back, until you’ve scored more points than the rest of the players and can claim the title of World Class Archaeologist.

195916.name: Castle Assault: Halting Force Promo Card
195916.description:
Promo Card for Castle Assault given out at GAMA 2016

Epic Neutral Command
Cost: 1
Target Unit gains -3 Movement while Charging for 1 turn (does not move backwards)

195917.name: Gangster - Unheimliche Unterwelt
195917.description:
Gangster in den goldenen Zwanzigern und dreckigen Dreißigern halten die USA fest in ihrem Griff. Organisierte Bandenbosse wie Al Capone herrschen wie Könige, freiberufliche Outlaws wie der Bankräuber John Dillinger ziehen eine blutige Spur des Verbrechens durch den Mittleren Westen.

Gangster in the golden twenties and the dirty thirties keep a tight grip on the USA. Organised bosses like Al Capone rule like kings, outlaws like the bank robber John Dillinger leave a bloody trail of crime in the west.

The book is about crime and law in general and the city of Chicago in particular. It is a setting and five adventures for Cthulhu.

195918.name: Out of the Park Baseball 17
195918.description:
Out of the Park Baseball 17 - now officially licensed by MLB.com and the MLBPA - is the best baseball management game ever created!

"OOTP is an astonishing accomplishment!" - Boston Red Sox Principal Owner John W. Henry

Out of the Park Baseball 17 is a baseball fan’s dream. Step into the shoes of a GM and/or field manager to own the future or rewrite the past of your favorite real-world franchise. Build the team the way you want to. Start a new career with your favorite 2016 MLB team or span through almost 150 years of baseball history and run any team from the past! You can even set up your own fictional baseball universe or compete in online leagues against other OOTP players. The possibilities in OOTP 17 are endless.

Source: The Developer Website.

195919.name: Slain!
195919.description:
Prepare to be Slain!
A gothic puzzle-combat platformer with gore galore. Putting a strategic twist on the classic hack and slash games of the ‘80s and ‘90s.’

Players control Bathoryn, a hero in a Gothic world, seeking to liberate seven great towers from 7 deadly overlords.
Bathoryn must battle his way through a doomed land packed with gruesome pixel art foes before ascending (or sometimes descending) each tower, defeating puzzles, traps and monsters alike. At the heart of each tower, he must confront a mighty overlord. Defeat it and Bathoryn’s quest continues. Fail, and you’ll die gruesomely – mauled by werewolves, disintegrated by floating monstrosities, squashed by great weights or torn apart by hidden blades. And you will fail…

Source: The Developer Website.

195920.name: Paws: A Shelter 2 Game
195920.description:
Might and Delight invites you to step into the world of Shelter 2 in a standalone adventure set in a fable world. This is Paws!

Dark and grime, twist through the vines
Slip through perils with finesse and toil
Be two for strength, be two of mind
Find the way home to familiar soil.

Step into the paws of a lynx cub as she takes her first steps in a vast environment. Overcome the obstacles of the harsh world as she gets separated from her family. Both friends and foes can be found on the way home…

The game combines all the unique elements from the much loved Shelter series to present a lovingly crafted story about loss, friendship and family.

Source: The Publisher Website.

195921.name: Panzer Dragoon R-Zone
195921.description:
Panzer Dragoon R-zone was a Tiger R-Zone game for the short-lived system. It was one of the few launch titles licensed by Sega, being released just a few months after the original Panzer Dragoon. It was the first game in the series that was not developed by Team Andromeda.

There is no plot, simply a nameless character on an armored dragon attempting to keep a dark dragon from reaching a tower while shooting and dodging robots.

Source: Wikipedia, "Panzer Dragoon (series)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

195922.name: PolyRace
195922.description:
PolyRace is a fast-paced futuristic racing game with a procedural level generator. Choose between 4 different hovercrafts with each of them having its own physic properties and a unique sci-fi hull. Run on generated terrains shaped with valleys, hills and mountains, mixing long straight lines and narrow curves while paying attention to your shield.

Source: The Developer Website.

195923.name: Carax '95
195923.description:
User Summary
Carex '95 is much like a combination of Space Invader and Tyrian-styled games:
You are in your space ship and shoot at a pack of aliens; when they are killed you warp ahead to a new pack.

You have a game limit of three minutes, and each time you get a non-lethal hit by an alien gun - or entire ship, you loose 10 seconds.
If you have a 70+% accuracy ratio, you gain additional time

195924.name: Carax '92
195924.description:
User Summary
Carex '92 is much like a combination of Space Invader and Tyrian-styled games:
You are in your space ship and shoot at a pack of aliens; when they are killed you warp ahead to a new pack.

You have a game limit of three minutes, and each time you get a non-lethal hit by an alien gun - or entire ship, you loose 10 seconds.
If you have a 70+% accuracy ratio, you gain additional time

195925.name: Dungeon Boss
195925.description:
From the publisher's site:
Dungeon Boss is a fast-action battle game loaded with tons of powerful heroes to collect and ascend. Summon your team to take down heavy hitting Bosses and their tireless minions from one challenging territory to the next. Build up your own power teams, and gain allies with cool Hero Sharing features, in this new free-to-play game.
http://forum.dungeonboss.com/

195926.description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city: they also give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Crossing borders require extra attention.There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board has only one grey track and no parallel tracks, though there are limited selective options for a colour change.

There are many new options in the rule:exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn double points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
195926.name: Gulf States (Fan expansion of Ticket to Ride)

195927.name: Alien Destroyer
195927.description:
User Summary

A Galaxian clone published by Sinclair Research for inclusion with the ZX Spectrum.

195928.name: Mediocre Monster
195928.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




User Summary

Imps. Goblins. Slimes. Shitake Mushrooms. These are a few of the first and weakest monsters you face in classic JRPGs like Final Fantasy, Dragon Quest, and Chrono Trigger. These monsters lead a depressing existence: walk around the forest, get slashed by a level 1 hero a few times, and disintegrate in an orange blur. Or so you think.

This is all in a day's work for the employees of "The Bestiary", the worldwide leader in random monster outsourcing. Employees go to the office each morning, get dressed, and go to work to pretend to die to heroes for their enjoyment.

Mediocre Monster puts you in the role of Gob, as he goes through everyday life working as a random monster. Follow Gob as he goes through a journey from being a lowly tutorial monster in the Tutorial Forest to being palette swapped into a well-respected monster who still dies to heroes easily, but after slightly more hits.

195929.name: Punchy
195929.description:
From the game inlay

Nasty Punch has locked Judy away in the Punch & Judy booth. You must rescue her by guiding brave Bobby the policeman across the stage.

To achieve success you must, among other challenges, make Bobby leap the obstacles, land on a flying carpet and rock the baby.

All the well known characters from the traditional Punch & Judy show make an appearance in this unique game.

195930.name: Splashdown
195930.description:
In this survival co-op, you and your crewmates find yourselves in the middle of an ocean on an alien world after a mishap during interstellar travel.

In 30 days a planet-wide storm will knock out all communications. You need to find three islands and repair the rescue beacons that were launched when your spacecraft was destroyed.

During your exploration you are as likely to find unwelcoming creatures as helpful items.

Decide how to use your stats, abilities, and dice allocation to face these challenges, and the challenge of propelling your watercraft through this ocean, and activate the distress signal. Otherwise, you will likely suffer the fate of this planet's previous inhabitants.

195931.name: Dueling Papers: San Francisco Edition
195931.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are all newspaper editors. They have Attributes, though they vary during play and are somewhat like Traits in more traditional games. Attributes include Standing, Honor, and Ideal/Agenda. Each editor has a newspaper which also has Attributes, including Circulation, Quality, and Popularity, which also vary during play. Characters pursue stories and headlines to boost the circulation and popularity of their newspaper. The game uses a somewhat math-heavy approach to determine outcomes. Playability is hampered by poor organization of the materials.

195932.name: Fading Hearts
195932.description:
An interactive story/game where you play the role of Ryou, a seemingly normal high school student in the land of Sorayama. Solve the mysteries that surround him while maintaining his friendships and saving Claire. Remain ignorant of the secrets and live a normal life or choose to learn the truth. Be careful where you put your priorities for it may prove fatal.

STORY:

“I am Ryou, a daydreamer and a student at Cyrstal Waters High . I have two very close female friends, Claire and Rina. I have a crush on my childhood friend Claire but she is already in a relationship. Rina seems to be attracted to me but… I can’t date Rina when I like Claire. I am a very idealistic but romantic kind of guy. It’s a complicated problem.

When I realized that Claire was suffering from an abusive relationship, everything changed. There was nothing Rina or I did that could get her out of it. There was one last resort. Breaking my romantic ideals to save Claire, I had to learn the art of seduction.

The only thing was… I started to learn that there was something going on in this town. Rumors of creatures running around at night, a close call, and a textbook history that doesn’t add up. Even Claire and Rina are connected somehow. Between finding out what is really going on and saving Claire, I don't know if I could manage both.

If only I could stop daydreaming so much then I might have some time. Why are my daydreams so strong now when I need to focus?”

FEATURES:

Your choices change the GENRE of the game!
Every NPC lies to you at some point in the game
Change the ending AND the final climax!
Daily Life-sim
RPG Battles!
Shocking plot-twists!

Source: The Developer Website.

195933.name: Move or Die
videogamehonor: 2015 Indie Prize Best Multiplayer Game Winner
2016 SXSW Gamer's Voice: Best Indie Game of the Year (Multiplayer) Nominee
195933.description:
User Summary

Move or Die is an absurdly fast-paced, 4-player local and online party game where the mechanics change every 20 seconds. The very definition of a perfect friendship-ruining game.

195934.name: ARK: Survival of the Fittest
195934.description:
User Summary

Survival of the Fittest is a multiplayer online survival arena spin-off based on ARK: Survival Evolved in which up to 72 players compete to be the last player surviving on the island. Game modes include free-for-all and team play. The game progresses at an accelerated rate with leveling, resource gathering, and taming taking considerably less time than in the original ARK game. Evolution events will happen over the course of the game that can help or hinder players in their competition for survival.


On August 1, 2016 Survival of the Fittest was re-integrated into Survival Evolved and is no longer a standalone game.

195935.name: Sydney's World
195935.description:
Explore an entirely new world. Meet new friends (and enemies) and fight monsters. Save Sydney...and her dad! Stop small dogs from barking, learn magic, and determine the fate of an entire world.

Sydney's World is not meant for children under eight. Girls and boys will enjoy the game equally. There is no running around collecting coins or blowing things up!

Sydney's World is like a game with a book inside that comes to life. You will even be able to hear Sydney and villains speak. Take turns reading different character parts with your parents, friends, or even your teachers!

Source: The Game Website.

195936.name: Juiced Rider
195936.description:
User summary:

The game focuses on pilots (operators) of mecha (large combat robots) though the play extends well beyond mecha combat and the game's primary theme involves the memories and minds of the characters. Action resolution uses pools of dice; a stripped pack of French playing cards is used to generate narrative events. The game materials included a character sheet as a separate download.

Note that in much of the Game Chef forum discussion this game erroneously was referred to as Juicy Rider.

195937.name: Blitz Breaker
195937.description:
An accessable, fast paced platformer with one small change, your character can't run! Play as a tiny robot named Blitz, and escape the factory where it seems everything is trying to break you.
The gameplay is as simple as it is satisfying. Blitz can only jump, and perform an air dash in one of 4 directions. Upon colliding with an object that doesn't break you, you are free to dash again. Use this to navigate the challenges ahead and reach the portal at the end of the stage.

Features in the final version:
- Simple, accessible PC controls. Both keyboard and gamepad are supported, and the entire game can be played one handed.
- Simple touch controls. Tap and swipe gestures are all you need to play on mobile.
- 101 levels with tough, but fair difficulty.
- Over 20 heads to collect, some with more interesting changes than others.
- Secret warp zones to find and conquer.
- A wicked chiptune soundtrack by Fat Bard

Source: The Developer Website.

195938.name: Boile de Muertre
195938.description:
User summary:

The game has several unusual elements placed together. First, an alternate-history future where the Napoleonic Empire has been victorious for hundreds of years. Second, a cultural fascination with an ancient Aztec game known as Ulama, of which a variant known as Boile de Muertre is played by the noble and royal houses of the Napoleonic Empire. Third is a play zone-signficant, deck-constructed card game played with Uno cards to determine the action and resolution of the Boile de Muertre matches. After the card game matches, the characters (abstracted nobles in the Napoleonic Empire) narrate the results.

The game suffers from poor organization and rather strained relationships between the major components.

195939.name: It's Spring Again
195939.description:
An educational app for children ages two and up. It uses game mechanics to teach children about the seasons.

The app is intended to develop associational and logical thinking. By following the hints, children help the seasons change. They learn the order of the seasons and create a melody for each of them with a little help from their parents and the narrator.

«It’s Spring Again» is based on a successful puppet show for children ages 2 to 5, in which puppets controlled by actors showed children audience the magic of change of seasons.
The game enriches the show by allowing children to directly interact with the story.

«The Forest Raised a Christmas Tree» puppet show Premiered in December 2013
Directed by Tamara Volynkina
Production Designer Asya Yurina
Puppet Theater of Murmansk Oblast

Ekaterina Efremova

The voice actor of the game’s narrator is a wonderful actress and a musician. She lives in Murmanks her whole life, performing for children and adults at puppet theaters, singing songs to a guitar and other instruments. She cooperates with musicians working in different genres, loves improvisation and is never afraid of experimenting in her art.

Source: The Game Website.

195940.name: Bomb Squad #9
195940.description:
Our fair city is under attack by militant anarchists and their nefarious time bombs. In response the Police Commissioner has selected you, our most expendable officers, to form Precinct 9's first Bomb Squad.

But it's not just the bombs you'll have to contend with. There's also the new sniffer dog that keeps setting them off, not to mention your back-stabbing colleagues who are all out for personal glory at your expense. Meanwhile the bombs keep on ticking down, one slip up means disaster, and someone keeps hiding the wire cutters!

Bomb Squad #9 is a game of bluffing and deduction, set against the slow ticking of a time bomb. Players search for the bomb and the wire cutters amongst nine face down cards. Each card has a special ability: allowing a second card to be seen (wire cutters, sniffer dog, metal detector), mixing the cards around (anarchist, panic), or just reacting to other cards (bomb, rat, can). On their turn, a player secretly looks at a card and declares it to the others. If they are not accused of lying, or if accused and acquitted, they get to perform the declared action. Certain combinations make the bomb explode, and if not defused the bomb explodes after six turns regardless. Bomb Squad #9 was derived as a combination and miniaturisation of Lost Legacy and Memory, but with a metal detector that actually beeps!

195941.name: Dark Explorations: The Quest to Reclaim the Past
195941.description:
A Simulationist Styled Game of Reconstruction of a Lost and Nearly Forgotten World.

From the introduction:

The World as it is currently: In memoriam of the past, and in anticipation of recreating it in the future, this is the task laid out before you, the quests to learn, the delvers, the seekers into the lost secrets of the ancient races and cultures that came before the Long Freeze.

The way things used to be: Before the massive thaw, before the ice that preceded that, and the scant records of the rising seas and floods that altered the land, the ancient nations stood tall and proud as the masters of all they could hold in their grips.

195942.name: Hydra Slayer
195942.description:
You are facing a nine-headed hydra. Your flaming longsword cuts five heads in each swipe (no more, no less), which will kill a five-headed hydra, but a larger hydra will regrow two heads after each swipe. Your storm scythe cuts exactly seven heads, but it makes ten heads grow back if the hydra is not dead. Is it possible to kill the hydra? What if you also had a silver dagger, which cuts just one head, but makes five heads grow back?

Hydra Slayer is a Roguelike game focused on one thing: slaying Hydras. It is inspired by Greek mythology, Dungeon Crawl, MathRL seven day roguelike, and some mathematical puzzles about brave heroes slaying many headed beasts.

Source: The Publisher Website.

195943.name: Brick Inventions
195943.description:
Brick Inventions is a physics based block game made in Unity 5. It combines simple blocks with physics, which creates a new, unique gameplay experience as everything you build can be destroyed. Build awesome structures, invent machines, master different challenges or play against other players in exciting multiplayer battles - the game contains a variety of modes:

Singleplayer

The singleplayer mode contains levels of which each one features a different kind of challenge. Amongst many others, these include:

Tower construction: In this level, you have to build a tower of a specific height. The challenge lies in figuring out a solid enough structure so that the tower doesn't collapse while using resources effectively.

Transport: In this level, an object has to be transported from one platform to another. To achieve this, the player has to create bridges, which are strong enough.

Destroy target: In this level, the player has to invent efficient weapons (for example cannons) to destroy structures.

Multiplayer

The multiplayer part of the game is more strategy oriented and contains different game types. In all of the game types, the players have areas in which they can build things on the opposite side of the map. In order to be able to build things, you have to create producers, which produce resources. Furthermore, you have to create warehouses to store resources. All strategic blocks, including producers and warehouses consist of a podium and an object, which lies on it. If this object falls off the podium, the object loses all upgrades. Therefore, you have to build defences in order to defend you production system. Currently the game contains two multiplayer modes, which have different goals:


Defend the crown: In this mode, the player has to defend a crown, which lies on a podium. Like described above, the player has to gain resources in order to build defences and weapons and to unlock more powerful blocks like the TNT-block or the accelerator-block.

Tower construction: In this mode, each player has to create a high enough tower. The first player, who builds such a tower and defends it for 2 minutes against attacks from the other player, wins the game.

Sandbox

In the sandbox mode you can build everything you want without limits. Sandbox maps can be saved so you don't have to worry to lose anything you've created. Currently, there is also a multiplayer sandbox in development in order to enable you to build and experiment with your friends.

Inventor mode

Since everything is created out of blocks, it might take long to build things that are more complex. The Inventor-mode enables you to create your own inventions out of bricks, which you can save and then place in singleplayer-, multiplayer- and sandbox-games like any other block. Invent a new machine, more efficient weapons or powerful defences - the better your ideas, the better are your chances of winning a multiplayer game or mastering a challenge in a singleplayer game.

Source: The Game Website.

195944.name: Awakening: The Redleaf Forest
195944.description:
Queen Sophia embarks on one final journey to rescue her parents and to defeat Dreadmyre once and for all. Her search has led her to the Redleaf Forest where she is to find the centaur who can help her forge the Blade of Courage. Will Sophia finally defeat the evil which has shadowed over her journey and be able to reunite with her parents?

Source: The Publisher Website.

195945.name: Avventure nei Domini
195945.description:
From the back of the book:
Bentornati nei Domini! In questo supplemento troverete le prime due avventure lunghe della linea di Beasts & Barbarians!
Inoltre, per i palati più raffinati… una storia eroica addizionale!

English translation:
Welcome back in the Domains! In this module you will find the first two adventures of the long line of Beasts & Barbarians!
In addition , for the most refined palates ... an additional heroic story!

195946.name: MiniGolf Mania
195946.description:
Grab some friends and step up to the tee as you putt your way through nine unique and challenging holes in MiniGolf Mania!

We’ve designed the controls to be very user-friendly while giving you precise control over the speed and direction of your shots.

Multiplayer: Up to 4 players in a competetive local game.

The Course: One hand-crafted course with 9 holes based on classic arcade games.

The Powerups: Featuring 6 unique power-ups designed to spice up multiplayer gameplay.

Source: The Developer Website.

195948.name: Wormskin (No. 2 - Spring Equinox 2016)
195948.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wormskin explores the mythic forest called Dolmenwood, a setting for use with B/X campaigns or similar tabletop systems. Each issue will look at various elements of this eldritch realm situated on the leafy verges of Faerie, where austere Drunes rub elbows with weird elf-lords and talking beasts, where witches wander skyclad and armed with sinister magicks to bind the spirits of hapless adventurers. Be wary.

Issue 2 includes:

An introduction to the High Wold, the south-westerly corner of Dolmenwood.
Descriptions of the seven hexes clustered around the village of Lankshorn.
Details of the most signifcant people and places in Lankshorn, including: the Hornstoat's Rest inn, the fairy-blooded bladesmith, the Man of Gold Apothecary, the Church of St Pastery.
Tavern fare generator.
Psychedelic compounds generator, including details on buying, selling, and manufacturing.
Seven new monsters: addercorn thralls, barrowbogeys, bog zombies, longhorn goatmen, shorthorn goatmen, nightworms, witch-owls.

195949.name: MasterBook EZ
195949.description:
From publisher blurb:

MasterBook is a universal roleplaying system. Flexible and easy to learn, the rules can be adapted to everything from science fiction to high fantasy, from pulp adventures to dark horror. Add the critically-acclaimed MasterDeck cards to enhance the action with more excitement and more drama, and your imagination is the only limit.

MasterBook EZ is the streamlined version of MasterBook, serving as an introduction to the mechanics. It is fully functional and ready to run, but like any lite version of a game, the mechanics have been distilled to their most-basic components for simpler and faster play. Two 10-sided dice are required. Once comfortable with MasterBook EZ, keep using it or step up to MasterBook for the full experience.

If you've never tried MasterBook, this will be the perfect starting point. If you have, this may also be the lighter version you have been seeking for times when you just want to run a quick and easy game.

195950.name: Casus Belli (v2, Issue 2 - Jun/Jul 2000)
195950.description:
(translated) from the cover:


Cyberpunk dossier
The universe of Serge Brussolo
French Version of AD&D
4th Prophecy
Reviews: Shadowrun III, Premiers Âges, Feng Shui


Includes Casus Master issue 2 (scenario booklet).

195951.name: Aurora Cendrillion
195951.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cohorts & Companions – Aurora Cendrillion provides twenty stat blocks (CR 1/2 thru 19) for a female aasimar shaman of the flame spirit along with her goat spirit companion. She specializes in fiery combat spells, healing, and battlefield control magic using a variety of metamagic feats.

This product is Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game compatible and gives you twenty ready-to-play stat blocks for a stalwart companion at all levels, 1 thru 20! Use these stat blocks to add companions or assistants to the party when players are absent, extra muscle is needed, or mercenaries are hired. This also gives the GM the ability to have potential cohorts on hand built at any level needed.

If you find the character’s history and other story elements not to your liking, you still have twenty NPC stat blocks you can use as standalone characters of your own naming and developing or as minions and other rabble. Increase your available NPC stat blocks at every character level (Challenge Rating 1/2 thru 19).

The Cohorts & Companions series is designed to make the GM’s life easier. Each release provides numerous stat blocks that can be used immediately along a specific theme. Locate a specific kind of foe to introduce into your campaign or collect them all to build a toolbox of NPCs to unleash at any time. Give your players a new ally today!

195952.name: Nécropole
195952.description:
Nécropole is a boardgame designed for 2 to 6 players, and can be played in several mode (teams, competitive or versus a game master).

Each player take control of up to 3 undead heroes. They can be vampires, necromancers or ghosts.
Each hero is chosen amongst three classes: sorcerer ★, warrior ⌽ or assassin ☾.

Classes will have great impact within attack phases during fights. They will give your heroes dedicated abilities (all unique).

⌽ Warriors master "talent" to dominate the battlefield.
★ Sorcerers are spell casters, specialized in control and area effect damages.
☾ Assassins use their skills to make surgical strikes against their preys.

Abilities and legendary artifacts are won by exploring the various Necropole's districts and accomplishing epic quests.
You can also attack your opponents and go into the slummy areas to trade souls for gear.

Possibilities are endless to fulfill your objectives and win the game.

As each card is unique, each game is unique too.

Now is your turn to master the Necropole, city of the dead.

Necropole is an epic game of exploration and skirmish fights.
Players will battle against other undeads (controlled by theor opponents or the game master), using cards in their hands and rolling dice.

195953.name: Dust in the Wind
195953.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Aerial Recon Search Team: The ARST are a specialized unit of mercenary airborne cavalry. The kinds of jobs on offer from such groups are often a bit dodgy and are under-compensated for the level of danger involved. But the mercs of the ARST will take those jobs, and they will do them well, because they are professionals. More than that, though, this is the only kind of life they care to live.

Dust in the Wind: A group of oil executives were negotiating a deal in the oil-rich kingdom of Kudesh. It is unclear at this time whether the deal went south, the executives insulted their hosts, or a resistance movement infiltrated the meeting. What is known is: the oil executives have been taken hostage and need to be rescued before they are executed on camera. But, there's a problem. Kudesh is a pariah state. To send in the cavalry would be to tacitly admit to having trade talks with one of the “exporters of evil.” Which is where the ARST comes in, hired to go where others cannot, and to do what others cannot bring themselves to do.

195954.name: Wrecking Iron
195954.description:
From publisher blurb:

Destruction Derby: Building iron and wrecking your opponents. That's what Destruction Derby is all about. Well, that and how fast and loose you can play with the rulebook. A new season of bashes and crashes begins soon!

Wrecking Iron: Buy an old vehicle. Fix it up. Prepare it for racing. Decide whether or not you're going to cheat. Try to sneak your cheats past the inspectors. Then get into the arena and bash into your opponents better than anyone else bashes into you! Throw in a racer or two suffering from petty jealousy and personality issues, a muddy track, and a tiny pot of prize money for the winner, and you have the pure essence of destruction derby! ...A muddy arena, a bunch of cheaters, and a vengeful rival all await in this, the first edition of Destruction Derby!

195955.name: Table Football
195955.description:
From the inlay:

At last a computer version of this fast and furious action packed football game. Use your computer joystick to take control of each line of players, angle deflection shots, great goalie saves, it's got the lot.

User Summary

This game was originally released as part of a compilation called "Pub Games" in 1986 before being given a standalone budget release.

Only the Atari version had a single player option, the Spectrum and Amstrad versions were two player only.

195956.name: Strix!
195956.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Amazing Races PDFs introduce new archetypes, feats, character traits, racial traits, and archetypes for the core, featured, and uncommon races described in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Advanced Race Guide. Every PDF contains two full pages of high quality content (no fluff or filler)!

Amazing Races: Strix! includes new racial feats, strix character traits, and alternate racial traits, and a new spell for strix. In addition, this product features a new archetype for strix paladins: the Swiftwing Crusader!

195957.name: TransOcean 2: The Rivals
195957.description:
In TransOcean 2: Rivals you face a new challenge as the boss of your own shipping line: The international competition has gotten a lot tougher and the battle for the most lucrative contracts has only just begun. Will you succeed in sweeping your rivals from the seven seas and leading your shipping line to global success and renown?
TransOcean 2: Rivals, the second chapter of the successful business simulation TransOcean, offers days of entertaining play either alone in its three single-player modes – Campaign, Endless Game and Competition - or with friends in a thrilling, competitive multiplayer mode. Get started with your newly founded shipping line in one of 60 ports and begin your career with a small fleet of worn-out old Feeders, the smallest type of ship in TransOcean 2: Rivals. Choose your port wisely and complete your first contracts to nearby ports in order to generate your first funds. Conduct your business with brains, plan your voyages with foresight and don’t underestimate external factors like the price of oil or your rival companies. This is how you will slowly expand your fleet and establish subsidiaries across the whole world. Are you up to mastering all the challenges? A livelier economic system influencing all kinds of goods ensures that in TransOcean 2: Rivals you are also faced with macroeconomic challenges. With the three types of ships - Tankers, Container Ships and Bulk Carriers - you have even more options to specialize and take your company to the top. Challenge your rivals and develop your own global business enterprise. In the single-player mode, you can also give yourself a very unique challenge: Steer your ships directly in a variety of 3D environments when the tugboats go on strike and the going gets tough. Can you maneuver both small and large vessels undamaged through the harbor basin?

Features
- Three varied game modes: The challenging Campaign, the calm Endless Game and the Competition mode against AI opponents
- The popular 3D mini game in single-player mode: Man the wheel of your own ship and navigate it through some pretty tricky situations
- Step up against other players in Multiplayer mode and use the best strategy to win Victory Points
- Sabotage your rival players
- Developed by Deck 13 Hamburg, the creative brains behind TransOcean: The Shipping Company
- New types of ships and cargo: Container ships, Tankers and Bulk ships, each with their own unique strengths and weaknesses
- Improve your ships with a wide range of upgrades
Over 60 ports across all continents
- Awesome orchestral soundtrack
- Expand your fleet and buy the biggest ships
- Set yourself new, dynamic challenges and become the best shipping magnate

Source: The Game Website.

195958.name: Casus Belli (v2, Issue 3 - Aug/Sep 2000)
rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (1st Edition)
195958.description:
(translated) from the cover:


Vampire the Masquerade review
Witchblade universe
Meta-barons preview
Start playing EverQuest
Guildes II review


Includes Casus Master issue 3 (scenario booklet).

195959.name: Traditional Race Book
195959.description:
From publisher blurb:

New Twists on Old Races!

We have 10 new races and 2 new subtypes- new spins on familiar races and monsters (as PCs)! These are new races, hot off the press, and ready to be dropped into your next game!

Each race comes not only with lore and racial traits (all of them are balanced as player races) but they each come with additional material. While it’s something of a mixed bag, we wanted to use these extra sections to say something about the race, they can include: racial weapons, racial feats, racial deities, racial animal companions, etc.

Highlights:

Militant owlbear people!
The return of the bladelings!
Rust monsters as player characters?!
Play as liberated homunculus!
Elves- from the moon!

195960.name: Troll Lands
195960.description:
User summary:

The game uses a complex and atypical character comprised of a troll, the troll's land, and possibly even a tribe of individuals. While it might appear that the troll is the character and everything else is a sort of resource, this is not actually correct. Character creation involves distributing dice among the troll and the tribe. Dice pools in the game are color-coded depending upon the type of land which identifies the character. Other aspects of the land also influence the number of dice available for the pools.

195961.name: Oddworld: Soulstorm
195961.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.





A follow-up to the critically acclaimed* release of Oddworld: New ‘n’ Tasty, Oddworld: Soulstorm picks up from Abe’s genesis and directly follows on from the overthrow of RuptureFarms and the liberation of his blighted workmates.Having defeated Molluck The Glukkon, his former boss and RuptureFarms’ meanest inhabitant, Abe soon finds himself - along with 300 newly emancipated Mudokons - without food, water or a place to call home. Stranded alone in the desert, they find solace in a strange new brew - a delicious drink that has insidious ramifications for their newfound freedom.

Oddworld: Soulstorm will continue to chew up the themes of environmentalism, capitalism, consumerism and addiction that critics and fans found so engaging in the "AAA Indie" release of Oddworld’s last pensive platformer, New ’n’ Tasty.

Source: The Developer Website.

195962.name: The Imperial Herald (Issue 10 - 1998)
rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (1st Edition)
195962.description:
From the cover:

- Secrets of the Wind
- Walking the Way
- Kapukksu's Story
- Oracle of the Void
- Private Lessons
- And more...

195963.name: Omnibus
195963.description:
OmniBus is a crazy Playstation 1 style physics game about the unstoppable force of nature that is OMNIBUS! The main mechanic of the game is trying to control the bus without being able to stop or slow down, while also slowly increasing in speed over time.

Source: The Developer Website.

195964.name: Friends or Fortune
195964.description:
User summary:

Characters in this storytelling game are all members of a ship's crew, embarked on a lengthy voyage of commercial interest. The game is intended closely to mirror similar historic voyages during the 16h century. Turn proceeds in phases with characters seeking narrative resolution to events. Characters are defined only by Traits, or narrative tags, including at least one "Anchor" - an item from home brought along on the voyage.

195965.name: The Imperial Herald (Issue 11 - 1999)
rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (1st Edition)
195965.description:
From the cover:

- Morikage
- War in Heavens
- Soul of the Fallen
- Rokugan-Asia
- Taka's Treasures
- And more...

195966.name: Ben 10 Game Generator
195966.description:
Calling all Ben 10 fans! It's time to put Ben's hero abilities to the test in an amazing new game. Play as Ben and guide him through 150 fun and challenging levels.

Test your game design skills and create and share your own levels with friends and Ben 10 fans.

Source: The Developer Website.

195967.name: The Imperial Herald (Issue 12 - Oct 1999)
rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (1st Edition)
195967.description:
From the cover:

- Designing Games
- The Gift of the Emperor
- War in the Heavens
- News from Court
- Kingdom in the Sun
- And more...

195968.name: The Imperial Herald (Issue 13 - Dec 1999)
rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (1st Edition)
195968.description:
From the cover:

- Hida Sukune & the Box of Greed
- L5R in Australia
- Strike at Midnight
- Nightmares
- Intro to the Fox Clan
- Clan of the Ki-Rin
- And more...

195969.name: In Frankenstein's Wake
195969.description:
User summary:

Characters in this intriguing game are pre-generated and presented as print-and-play components in the rules. Some options for customization exist but they are fairly limited. Characters have Attributes (Brilliance, Charm, and Skullduggery), each with an associated dice type and a "point pool" that allows for re-rolls. Characters also have Skills and Traits, also with associated dice type and "point pool". Characters spend their time pursuing grisly experiments along the lines of mentor Dr. Frankenstein.

195970.name: In Frankenstein's Wake: Materials Deck
195970.description:
User summary:

This document presents a deck of print-and-play resource cards for use during the game. Samples include things like "Fresh Human Brain", "Shapely Torso", and "Gangrenous Limbs".

195971.name: Beyond the Shadow
195971.description:
(publisher blurb)

Beyond the shadow is a combat based drawing game. Players find themselves trapped in a dark dungeon with monsters around every turn. The Game Master describes the monsters and the players draw what they believe it looks to determine their attack. Can your party make it out alive?

195972.name: An Inordinate Fondness
195972.description:
From the introduction:

Intelligent insect societies have inherited the earth following the extinction of humanity. Characters are man-sized social insects – ants, termites, wasps, or bees – reacting to, exploring the relics of, and misinterpreting their human predecessors. Since the bugs are newly sentient they don’t have any sense of history. They don’t remember that humans viewed insects as inconsequential - when they weren’t exterminating them as pests.

The game’s title is from an anecdote about the biologist J.B.S. Haldane, who, when asked what one could infer about the creator from studying nature, is reported to have replied: "an inordinate fondness for beetles." The phrase also stands in for the insects’ romanticization of humankind.

195973.name: Path to the Sky
195973.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of N/A.




Path to the Sky is a roguelike platformer that gets harder as you climb up.

Source: The Developer Website.

195974.name: The Interactive Adventures of Dog Mendonça & Pizzaboy
195974.description:
Based on Filipe Melo, Juan Cavia and Santiago Villa`s IP, “The Adventures of Dog Mendonça & Pizza Boy”, was conceived as a complex universe, full of compelling stories and attractive characters. To broaden the experience we have created several entertainment properties, with an independent life, that will work as multiple entry points into this universe. Each of these products will develop diﬀerent aspects of the plot and different time frames for the viewer to unravel all the mysteries surrounding the Dog Mendonça Universe across an array of Medias:
– A series of Published COMIC BOOKS: volumes have been published in Portugal by Tinta Da China and by Dark Horse Comics in the US and the UK while a new volume is in the works.
– A series of VIDEOGAMES (in production): set as a series of episodical point-and-click adventure games that will deal with a new case in each installment. The mysteries usually go deeper than what the group expects, forcing them to work their full potential and, from time to time, to save the world. Not a big deal, when it comes to them. The first game will start with a new plot but not as a sequel to the books. The characters will be introduced in a fun way -as in the old Sam & Max games- and then, if the user reads the comics, he’ll pick up some jokes or references to those stories; but they won’t affect the game’s experience. Supported platforms: Mobile (IOS/Android), PC (Mac/Windows/Linux) and Consoles (PS3, Vita).
-TV(in development): With a lot of comedy, action and adventure we’ll get to know Dog and his team while travelling the world to whatever place they are hired to solve a new case. In each episode Eurico, as the new intern of the company, will learn how Dog and Pazuul solved a similar case in the past, and then try to face the danger himself.

Source: The Developer Website.

195975.name: Once More
195975.description:
A Game of Reincarnation and Coming to Terms

User summary:

Characters in this complex game progress along a meta-physical path of self enlightenment; the process and concept is loosely based upon Buddhist thought. Characters have several Traits, though most are quite variable. One persistent Trait is a Shade, or an archetype that anchors the character's incarnations. Characters also may have Attachments that they tend to return to over and over again (for example, Romantic Love or Dishonesty). Play proceeds on a board, or action surface, with rolled dice being placed in stages to archive progress (the game thus requires a large number of dice).

The document includes the actin surface and a character sheet as print-and-play components.

195976.name: The City at the Edge of Sleep
rpg: The City at the Edge of Sleep
195976.description:
From the introduction:

In the back of your mind, you remember dreams of another you - a you that wakes up to an alarm, that drinks coffee and watches TV, that laughs and cries over words and deeds of others. Those dreams stopped a while ago, flickering into white filminess like a projector at the end of a film reel. Like most dreams, the details of that life have become gauzy and intangible, fading away to feelings and impressions. Was it ever really you, or just another bland, albeit peculiar, dream in a series of fantasies?

User summary:

This is a cool game.

195977.name: Dungeon Dashers
195977.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.





Dungeon Dashers is an action packed, turn-based, co-operative dungeon crawler, bringing the enjoyment of a tabletop board game with friends to the PC. Dungeon Dashers streamlines the core dungeon crawler experience to its essentials, for an intense, loot-grabbing adventure.WHAT WILL YOU FIND?

Accumulate wealth by smashing boxes full of gold, slaying monsters, and looting glowing chests. Use your gold to buy consumables to boost your abilities or craft upgrades for your equipment. Find new swords, bows, staffs, spells and other equipment hidden in chests obscured by challenges and quests.

Source: The Game Website.

195978.name: Super Bomb Rush!
195978.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of N/A.




Super Bomb Rush is a quick fire, highly challenging Defuse 'Em Up!

Keep calm as you defuse a barrage of bombs, each one more complex than the last, all within five seconds. Can you clear all 50 and proclaim yourself a Master of defusal? Just remember to REMAIN CALM!

Features:
- Addictive, challenging, yet rewarding bomb defusal action!
- Arcade Mode beckons with 50 intense bombs to conquer!
- Versus Mode allows you to challenge a friend to a duel to the boom!

- Co-op Mode allows you and a friend (or friends!) to work together to overcome the barrage as a team!
- Beat Rush Mode is a unique, stage-based quest mode where you defuse to the beat!
- Delve deeper into SBR! by completing special Challenges that unlock super-secret content!
- Music produced by ArgoFox. A soundtrack so full of pure energy and filthy bass, it should be made illegal!

Source: The Game Website.

195979.name: Burly Men at Sea
videogamehonor: 2016 SXSW Gamer's Voice: Best Indie Game of the Year (Single player) Nominee
2017 IGF Awards Excellence in Narrative Honorable Mention
195979.description:
A folktale about a trio of large, bearded fishermen who step away from the ordinary to seek adventure.

Set in early 20th-century Scandinavia, the game's story branches through discovery in a series of encounters with creatures from folklore. You play as storyteller and wayfinder, shaping the narrative around the characters through interaction with their environment.
Burly Men at Sea is currently in development by husband-and-wife team Brain&Brain, scheduled for release in 2016.

Source: The Game Website.

195980.name: Hubert's Island Adventure: Mouse o' War
195980.description:
Features:

- DRM-free!

- Low price!

- Windows, OS X, and Linux supported!

- Controller support!

- Non-linear platforming action with large levels to explore!

- Tight controls and physics!

- Bright, colorful world to explore with tons (and tons!) of secret nooks and crannies to discover!

- Upgrades found throughout the game that allow entry into new areas (Metroidvania style!)

- Earn candy as you play, and spend it on crazy unlocks!

- New Game Plus mode!

- Myriad traps, monsters, and hazards out to destroy you!

- Bosses to crush!

- Detailed stats on everything you do!

- Awesome achievements to unlock!

- Ride-able cows featuring Positional Mooing technology!

- Survival Mode, in which you attempt to... survive!

- Cooperative (local) multiplayer for both Adventure and Survival mode!

- (Very rough) level editor available!

- Game engine is open source!

Synopsis
Zip and zap your way to victory!

Hubert's Island Adventure: Mouse o' War is a 2D sidescrolling-platformer-action-adventure game set on a tropical island. You will control Hubert, or one of his friends, in a quest to rescue the kidnapped Sally and save the Island from the dread pirate Dakkar. However, Dakkar has covered the Island in traps and henchmen, and it will be no easy task defeating him and his 4 lieutenants! Hubert's lovely picnic lunch has also been scattered across the Island, and it will be up to you to find the lost leaves and cheese.

Work alone or with your friends in cooperative multiplayer mode! Can you recover the leaves and cheese, defeat Dakkar and his cronies, and save both Sally and the entire Island? Find out now!

The game is currently available for Windows, OS X, and Linux!
